places.name: Restaurant & Bar Zürichberg

places.name: Rapperswil-Jona Youth Hostel
places.description: The youth hostel is located in Rapperswil-Jona, just five minutes from the lake and 30 minutes from the historic city center.

places.name: Ibis Zurich Messe Airport Hotel
places.description: The ibis Zurich Messe Airport hotel is located between Zurich Airport and the city center, very close to the Hallenstadion indoor stadium and the exhibition center.

places.name: Hotel Ibis Zurich City West
places.description: The Ibis Zurich City West is located in the heart of the lively Zürich-West quarter, close to Hardbrücke train station and just 15 minutes from the picturesque Lake Zurich.

places.name: Hotel Ibis Zurich-Adliswil
places.description: The Ibis Zurich-Adliswil is located on the A3 highway, directly by the Zürich-Wollishofen exit.

places.name: Hotel Ibis Budget Zurich City West
places.description: The Ibis Budget Zurich City West is located in the heart of the lively Zurich-West quarter, close to Hardbrücke train station and just 15 minutes from the picturesque Lake Zurich.

places.name: Hotel Hottingen
places.description: The Hotel Hottingen lies in the very heart of Zurich, close to the Kunsthaus and the Old Town, with the St Peter’s Church and the Fraumünster.

places.name: Hotel Sternen Oerlikon
places.description: This business hotel is located in the center of Oerlikon, just five minutes’ walk from Zürich Oerlikon Train Station. Both Zurich Main Station and the airport are quick and easy to reach.

places.name: Hotel Allegro Einsiedeln
places.description: The Hotel Allegro lies between the famous abbey village of Einsiedeln and Lake Sihl, but also enjoys a prime location between Zurich, Zug, and Lucerne.

places.name: Hotel Holiday Inn Zürich-Messe
places.description: The Holiday Inn Zürich-Messe is ideally located between the airport and the city center, directly opposite the famous Hallenstadion and the exhibition center.

places.name: Hotel Holiday Inn Express Zürich Airport
places.description: The Holiday Inn Express Zürich Airport is just 10 minutes from Zurich Airport, 5 minutes from Rümlang train station, and 15 minutes from central Zurich.

places.name: Hotel Helvetia
places.description: The boutique hotel, Hotel Helvetia, is located at Stauffacher, between the elegant Kreis 1 district and the vibrant Langstrasse quarter.

places.name: Hotel Helmhaus
places.description: The Hotel Helmhaus lies on the history-steeped Schifflände, in the heart of the city of Zurich and directly on the bank of the River Limmat.

places.name: Greulich Design & Boutique Hotel
places.description: The Greulich Design & Boutique Hotel is located in the heart of the trendy Kreis 4 district, not far from Langstrasse and the Bäckeranlage.

places.name: Glärnischhof by Trinity
places.description: This hotel is located in the heart of the city of Zurich, not far from the Bahnhofstrasse and the banking and financial district.

places.name: Gasthof Löwen
places.description: The Gasthof Löwen is situated in the idyllic village of Bubikon in the Zurich Oberland.

places.name: Gasthof Hirschen am See
places.description: This charming guesthouse directly on the lakefront is situated in Meilen on Zurich’s Gold Coast.

places.name: Gasthof Hirschen Regensdorf
places.description: The Gasthof Hirschen in Regensdorf is situated just 20 minutes from the airport and downtown Zurich.

places.name: Gasthof Frohberg
places.description: The Gasthof Frohberg is situated in an idyllic garden, overlooking the rooftops of Rapperswil.

places.name: Guesthouse fürDich
places.description: Enjoy a charming and stylish stay: the Guesthouse fürDich is located in the heart of the Langstrasse quarter, opposite the Bäckeranlage.

places.name: Vacation Apartment in Rapperswil, Greithstrasse
places.description: This vacation apartment is located on Greithstrasse, in the heart of the historic town of Rapperswil.

places.name: Ferienhaus im Rebberg
places.description: The Ferienhaus im Rebberg is situated in Stäfa, on Zurich’s famous “Gold Coast”.

places.name: Hotel Europe
places.description: The Hotel Europe is situated behind the Opera House in the green and central Seefeld quarter.

places.name: Engimatt City & Garden Hotel
places.description: The hotel is situated in Zurich’s Enge district, in a quiet park between Sihlcity and the banking and financial quarter.

places.name: La Réserve Eden au Lac Zurich
places.description: Unique and elegant, the legendary hotel is reborn, after several months of an ambitious undertaking nurtured by the creativity of Philippe Starck and La Réserve’s vision of excellence.

places.name: easy Hotel Zürich
places.description: The easyHotel Zürich is located on Langstrasse, next to Europaallee and very close to Zurich Main Station.

places.name: Crowne Plaza Zurich Hotel
places.description: The Crowne Plaza Zurich business hotel is located in the popular Aussersihl quarter, not far from Langstrasse and Züri West.

places.name: Hotel Courtyard by Marriott Zürich Nord
places.description: The Courtyard hotel skillfully combines business with the comforts of life.

places.name: Hotel City Zürich
places.description: Small and well-kept, the Hotel City Zürich lies in the heart of the city: the famous Bahnhofstrasse and the financial and business center are all just around the corner.

places.name: Central Plaza Hotel
places.description: The elegant Central Plaza lies directly on the River Limmat, directly next to the Central tram hub and just a stone’s throw from Zurich Main Station and the Old Town.

places.name: Hotel Bristol
places.description: This welcoming hotel in the heart of Zurich is just a five-minute walk from the main station.

places.name: Glockenhof Zürich
places.description: The city hotel, Glockenhof, is located in the very heart of Zurich, just a stone’s throw from the Bahnhofstrasse.

places.name: Sorell Hotel Speer
places.description: The wonderful Sorell Hotel Speer lies in the center of the historical town of Rapperswil.

places.name: Hotel Belvoir
places.description: The fantastic view over Lake Zurich to the Glarus Alps makes the Hotel Belvoir in idyllic Rüschlikon a unique oasis.

places.name: Hotel Ameron Zurich Bellerive au Lac
places.description: Situated in the heart of Zurich, with the lake on the doorstep and Sechseläutenplatz nearby, this elegant hotel is reminiscent of the Art Deco period.

places.name: Baur au Lac
places.description: A rich tradition and an exclusive atmosphere of well-being await guests at the Baur au Lac, situated in its own park in the heart of Zurich.

places.name: B2 Hotel Hürlimann-Areal
places.description: With its stylish rooms, modern conference facilities and spa, this hotel in the historic Hürlimann brewery building provides everything you could possibly wish for.

places.name: Hotel Arlette
places.description: A wonderful small family-run hotel, close to the main railway station and the National Museum, right in the center of town.

places.name: Aparthotel Familie Hugenschmidt
places.description: At home in Zurich – the Aparthotel is located in Zurich’s charming Seefeld district.

places.name: Ambassador Hotel Zürich
places.description: The privately-managed boutique hotel in Zurich’s Seefeld quarter offers guests an exclusive retreat in the heart of the city of Zurich.

places.name: Altstadt Hotel
places.description: Whether the Grossmünster or the Bahnhofstrasse – The Altstadt Hotel lies within walking distance of Zurich’s main tourist attractions.

places.name: Hotel Alexander Guesthouse
places.description: The personal, family-run guesthouse is located in the Niederdorf quarter, just a stone’s throw from Zurich Main Station.

places.name: Hotel Alexander
places.description: The welcoming Hotel Alexander lies in a prime location in the heart of Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Alden Hotel Splügenschloss
places.description: Pure relaxation in the exclusive boutique hotel situated in the heart of Zurich and not far from Lake Zurich.

places.name: Hotel Adler Zürich
places.description: The Hotel Adler is located in the heart of the Niederdorf, Zurich’s famous Old Town.

places.name: 25hours Hotel Zürich West
places.description: The designer hotel lies in the trendy Zürich-West quarter, just a few minutes from the city center and Zurich Airport.

places.name: Au Peninsula
places.description: Off to the countryside: the Au peninsula on Lake Zurich is ideal for a day trip featuring plenty of hiking, swimming, and relaxing.

places.name: Sihl Adventure Trail – Hike from the Source of the River to the City
places.description: A walk in seven stages along the Sihl river toward Zurich.

places.name: Strandbad Seefeld Lachen
places.description: Sunbathe, swim, and enjoy delicious snacks as if you were somewhere by the sea.

places.name: Seebad Altendorf
places.description: The charming lido with a pebble beach is something of an insider tip on the upper end of Lake Zurich.

places.name: Lake Zug
places.description: Switzerland’s ninth largest lake offers an abundance of leisure activities. The choice is yours.

places.name: Türlersee Lake
places.description: Small but great - at the Türlersee lake, a day trip feels like a vacation.

places.name: Freibad Allenmoos
places.description: In Oerlikon, a large park with several swimming pools invites guests to relax and have fun.

places.name: Freibad Letzigraben
places.description: The open-air public bath designed by writer and architect Max Frisch treats guests to three swimming pools and a beautiful park.

places.name: Pfäffikersee Lake
places.description: Traces of the Romans, an adventure farm, and three lidos – there is something for everyone around the Pfäffikersee.

places.name: Wägitalersee Lake
places.description: The reservoir in the Wägital valley particularly attracts rock climbers, amateur anglers, and jogging enthusiasts.

places.name: Sihlsee Lake
places.description: Adventure awaits the youngest visitors at the largest reservoir in Switzerland. Meanwhile, the grown-ups can relax on the lakeshore or enjoy a cruise on the lake.

places.name: Greifensee Lake
places.description: A wonderful nature experience for hikers, cyclists, and families who like to be active.

places.name: Lützelsee Lake
places.description: Lake Lützel is located at the transition from Lake Zurich to the Zurich Oberland and, with its moors and small lakes, is one of the most beautiful lakes in the region.

places.name: Walensee Lake
places.description: The spectacular, contrasting nature makes an excursion to the Walensee lake particularly memorable.

places.name: Muotatal in Summer
places.description: This valley is a ruggedly romantic area of Switzerland, with impressive scenery and actively lived customs. It is well worth exploring.

places.name: Thurauen Nature Center
places.description: From the canalized and diverted river to its diverse floodplain, the revitalized Thurauen offers a rich habitat for protected species and relaxation for nature-lovers.

places.name: Rubber Dinghy Trip on the Linth
places.description: A rubber dinghy trip through the tranquil, renaturalized Linth Canal is both fun and relaxing.

places.name: Strandbad Stampf
places.description: The lido, Strandbad Stampf, attracts guests of all ages with its wide range of activities and promises many memorable moments in or by the water.

places.name: Lido Egg
places.description: The beautiful, well-maintained bathing facility on the upper part of Lake Greifen

places.name: Lido Richterswil
places.description: The lido in Richterswil is a real gem on Lake Zurich.

places.name: Schmerikon Baths
places.description: The swimming pool in Schmerikon is affectionately known by the locals as the "Badi Schmerkä".

places.name: Egelsee
places.description: The Egelsee lakeside bathing facility offers families access to beautiful natural surroundings and invites them to swim, paddle, sunbathe and play.

places.name: Lake Zurich Circular Tour – Complete a Circuit of the Lake in 10 Stages
places.description: Various footpaths lead around Lake Zurich that enable you to complete a circuit of the lake.

places.name: Aabachtal Nature Experience – Hiking by the Roaring River Aabach
places.description: The Aabachtal valley is a nature paradise close to Lake Zurich and offers plenty of recreation opportunities for city residents.

places.name: Ufnau Island
places.description: The abbey-owned island of Ufnau is the larger of the two islands on the upper part of Lake Zurich, near Rapperswil-Jona.

places.name: Lützelau Island
places.description: An idyllic retreat in the middle of Lake Zurich, just a few minutes by boat from Rapperswil-Jona.

places.name: Kuster Sport
places.description: Rent a canoe or a SUP in Schmerikon and enjoy a relaxed day on Upper Lake Zurich.

places.name: Stand-Up Paddle School – the Trendy Water Sport Reaches Lake Zurich
places.description: Stand-up paddling is becoming increasingly popular among water sport enthusiasts. A school at Lake Zurich offers courses.

places.name: Lake Zurich
places.description: Lake Zurich was once above all a transport route. Today, it is a popular excursion point for swimming, boating or having a picnic on the lake's banks.

places.name: Upwind-Sailing – Sailing with a Vintage Yacht on Lake Zurich
places.description: An excursion on Lake Zurich with a vintage sailing yacht is an unforgettable experience.

places.name: Ceccotorenas Wakeboarding School in Stäfa on Lake Zurich
places.description: In Stäfa on Lake Zurich, the Ceccotorenas Wakeboarding School offers water lovers a wide range of courses, as well as a selection of water sports equipment and boats for hire.

places.name: Strandbad Tiefenbrunnen
places.description: This open-air bathing facility lies in the middle of a park on the right shore of Lake Zurich.

places.name: Strandbad Mythenquai
places.description: This lakeside open-air public swimming bath, with its non-swimmer area and water fountains, is particularly suitable for children.

places.name: Round Trips on the Lake – Lake Zurich Navigation Company
places.description: A relaxed ride on Lake Zurich is part of a visit to Zurich. And the chance to get to know the city and its surroundings from another angle.

places.name: Seebad Utoquai
places.description: The historic Seebad Utoquai bathing facility is located on the bustling lakeside promenade between Bellevue and Zürichhorn.

places.name: Seebad Enge
places.description: The Seebad Enge outdoor bathing facility offers relaxation ‒ in summer with swimming, in winter in the sauna – and a fabulous view over Lake Zurich.

places.name: Katzensee Lake
places.description: Nestling in a nature reserve, this small, idyllic lake is the favorite place of many stressed-out city dwellers.

places.name: Rhine Falls – Europe’s Biggest Waterfall
places.description: Europe's biggest waterfall is in Switzerland. Rhine Falls near Schaffhausen fascinates visitors with its great water volume.

places.name: Flussbad Unterer Letten
places.description: The Unterer Letten is the oldest riverside bathing facility in the city of Zurich, and is a popular meeting place among local residents.

places.name: Frauenbad at Stadthausquai
places.description: At this bathing facility for women, female guests can swim undisturbed against a spectacular backdrop.

places.name: Flussbad Oberer Letten
places.description: Just a stone’s throw from Zurich Main Station, bathers can drift leisurely downriver.

places.name: Au-Höngg River Pool
places.description: Swimming in Limmat canal – the river pool at Werd Island is in Zurich Höngg.

places.name: Limmatquai – Where Zurich’s History Meets Fashion and Culinary Delights
places.description: Limmatquai leads through the middle of Zurich's old town and past many interesting sights and trendy shops

places.name: WOW Museum
places.description: These rooms full of illusions will leave visitors completely confused at what they are perceiving.

places.name: Lindt Home of Chocolate
places.description: A dream for all chocolate fans: near Lake Zurich, Lindt invites visitors to a multimedia experience world.

places.name: Sihlwald Exhibition at Wildnispark Zurich
places.description: An exciting expedition into the history, present and future of the Sihlwald forest near Zurich.

places.name: “Goldapfel” Gingerbread Bakery & Museum
places.description: Delicious Einsiedeln specialties from a tradition-steeped establishment: in this store complete with museum, visitors can browse and buy.

places.name: WWF Beaver Trail
places.description: On the Beaver Trail along the Rhine, young explorers can find out all about these industrious animals.

places.name: Naturmuseum Winterthur
places.description: At the Nature Museum in Winterthur, discoverers both big and small can explore the fascinating indigenous natural world.

places.name: FIFA Museum
places.description: The FIFA Museum is an interactive experience world for people of all ages, and is guaranteed to get all soccer fans’ pulses racing.

places.name: Museum Burg Zug – Experience History in an Interactive Way
places.description: On a visit to the museum in Zug Castle, guests of all ages learn about the lives of the local inhabitants in bygone days.

places.name: Natural History Museum of the University of Zurich
places.description: There is quacking, shrieking, grunting and chirping at the University of Zurich’s Natural History Museum. The museum is home to 1.500 animals and skeletons and many can be heard.

places.name: Tram Museum Zurich
places.description: The ringing and rattling of trams is part of everyday life in Zurich. The Tram Museum provides a stage for this charming means of transportation.

places.name: Technorama Winterthur – the Only Science Center in Switzerland
places.description: The Technorama does not just make children want to play. Exciting experiments explain the laws of physics and chemical reactions.

places.name: Bruno Weber Park – a Fantasy Landscape With Art You Can Touch
places.description: Immerse yourself in Bruno Weber's artistic dream world in a garden full of mythical creatures and characters.

places.name: Swiss Children's Museum Baden
places.description: Three hundred years of childhood culture can be experienced in a magnificent villa.

places.name: Aathal Dinosaur Museum – Encounter the Giants of the Past
places.description: The Aathal Dinosaur Museum features a spectacular dinosaur exhibition with original skeletons from the Jurassic period.

places.name: Museum Schloss Kyburg
places.description: Situated near to Winterthur, Kyburg Castle towers 150 meters (490 ft) above the River Töss. Kyburg Castle is a very well preserved feudal castle and the oldest castle museum in Switzerland.

places.name: Mühlerama – The Tireless Mill on Lake Zurich
places.description: The Mühlerama unites an industrial mill and a museum for eating culture with its own baking school.

places.name: National Museum Zurich
places.description: The National Museum Zurich is located behind the Main Station and is the most frequently visited museum of cultural history in Switzerland.

places.name: Kulturama Museum of Human Evolution
places.description: Interactive: at Kulturama, visitors can experience 600 million years of evolution with all the senses.

places.name: Coal Mine Käpfnach
places.description: The tunnel train rattles its way through the disused Käpfnach Mine while providing visitors with insight into the arduous mining work.

places.name: Royal Panda
places.description: The Royal Panda on Zurich’s Kreuzplatz treats guests to a wide range of Asian cuisine.

places.name: Panoramarestaurant Albishaus
places.description: In Langnau am Albis, not far from the Türlersee lake, the Restaurant Albishaus delights guests with delicious dishes and wonderful views.

places.name: tibits Seefeld Bistro
places.description: The tibits Seefeld Bistro is located on Falkenstrasse, in the immediate vicinity of the Opera House.

places.name: tibits Oerlikon
places.description: The vegetarian restaurant, tibits, enjoys a central location near the Sternen Oerlikon and spoils its guests from early in the morning to late in the evening.

places.name: Bergrestaurant Farneralp
places.description: The Farneralp is situated at 1,145 meters (3,757ft) above sea level, just up from the high-altitude rehabilitation center, Zürcher RehaZentrum Wald. Guests can reach the mountain restaurant after an approximately 30-minute walk along the car-free road.

places.name: Frieda’s Büxe
places.description: Frieda’s Büxe is renowned for its legendary after-hours parties – when fans of electronic music can dance all through the night until 10 o'clock the next morning.

places.name: Au Premier
places.description: Elegant atmosphere, excellent drinks: located right in Zurich's main train station, this bar offers a stylish place to relax.

places.name: Flor Café Bar
places.description: Stylish lounge in Zurich’s Seefeld quarter.

places.name: Nude Café Bar
places.description: A hidden gem on the banks of the Limmat river.

places.name: Cha Cha Cha Bar
places.description: The Cha Cha Cha Bar is a breath of fresh air in the Niederdorf district, with colorful drinks, relaxed vibes, and music for every mood.

places.name: Rooftop Bar "1838"
places.description: With a view of Lake Zurich, guests can enjoy exquisite cocktails on the sunny panoramic terrace.

places.name: Drinx Bar
places.description: From Tuesday to Saturday, this bar near the Opera House invites you to relax after work or to enjoy an apéro.

places.name: Lady Hamilton’s Pub
places.description: At this pub near the train station, guests can experience modern British pub culture and enjoy a wide selection of international beers.

places.name: Raygrodski
places.description: In the booming Kreis 3 district, one bar focuses solely on the drinks of the evening – with great passion and success.

places.name: Bar Sacchi
places.description: A pinch of Italianità, a small but select choice of beverages, and spectacular Negroni cocktails make this bar in Wiedikon an absolute favorite.

places.name: Amboss Rampe
places.description: Not just for fans of the in-house Amboss beer: at the Rampe, there is something for each and every taste.

places.name: Bar am Wasser
places.description: Its name is as unpretentious as its drinks, service, and metropolitan flair are swanky.

places.name: Central 1
places.description: For a brief time-out or a longer stay, the Central 1 café bar in the Central Plaza Hotel is a lively meeting place.

places.name: La Stanza
places.description: The coffee bar, La Stanza, captivates with its Italian charm. Here guests sip their espresso or aperitivo standing at the elegant wooden counter, just like in Italy.

places.name: Le Raymond Bar
places.description: The popular location for coffee and cocktail lovers, directly on the Schanzengraben canal and close to Paradeplatz.

places.name: Akt Niederdorf
places.description: A bar for all those who like to mix with cheerful people, for at the Akt locales, there is always a great atmosphere.

places.name: Restaurant & Bar Aurora
places.description: Four young gastronomes have set up and opened a gourmet oasis on the world-famous Bahnhofstrasse.

places.name: Razzia
places.description: How about dinner in a former movie theater? This is possible at the spectacular Razzia restaurant in the beautiful Seefeld quarter.

places.name: Josef
places.description: The restaurant, Josef, in Zürich-West has done away with the main course and instead enables inquisitive food lovers to try out creatively combined dishes from all over the world, just as they please.

places.name: Restaurant & Bar Talacker
places.description: Noodle soup and Thai cuisine at lunchtime, bar and DJs in the evening ‒that is the Talacker, situated between Paradeplatz and Stauffacher.

places.name: Atelier Bar
places.description: The beautiful bar near Paradeplatz impresses with its interior, but also with first-class wines and culinary delicacies.

places.name: Turmbar – Boutiquehotel Sonne
places.description: The Turmbar is the perfect place to go for a glass of wine after work or for cocktails before dinner.

places.name: Bottéga Club and Lounge
places.description: The Bottéga Club and Lounge welcomes guests at the gateway to the Old Town in the Town of Roses, Rapperswil.

places.name: Clouds Bar & Bistro
places.description: Your head in the clouds, your feet on the ground in the heart of Zürich-West – Zurich’s highest bar invites guests to enjoy a cocktail or two before a night on the town.

places.name: Carlton Restaurants & Bar
places.description: The spacious Carlton Restaurant with its quiet garden terrace is located in the heart of Zurich on the famous Bahnhofstrasse.

places.name: Bagatelle 93
places.description: This club, which lies directly on Langstrasse, mainly attracts a young clientele.

places.name: Nelson Pub
places.description: A laid-back British ambiance, fish’n’chips, and a huge selection of beer can be found in the heart of the city.

places.name: Escherwyss Club
places.description: All music tastes are catered for in the old factory hall in Zürich-West.

places.name: McGee’s Irish Pub & Restaurant
places.description: This Irish pub located directly next to Wiedikon Train Station attracts expatriates and local residents alike.

places.name: Papiersaal
places.description: Concerts, parties, and other events are held on the top floor of the former paper factory on the River Sihl.

places.name: Kanonaegass
places.description: A bar with a club atmosphere or club with a bar atmosphere? The Kanonaegass unites the best of both worlds.

places.name: Bogen F
places.description: The concert venue located under the rearmost viaduct arch has a very distinctive atmosphere.

places.name: Widder Garage
places.description: The place that once housed horse-drawn carriages and luxury automobiles now serves as a bar.

places.name: The Alehouse – Palmhof
places.description: Here, everything that beer lovers could possibly wish for flows out of 20 taps.

places.name: Oliver Twist Pub
places.description: Lovers of “typically English” culture and homesick expats can find a taste of the British way of life in Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Kon-Tiki Coffeeshop & Bar
places.description: The Kon-Tiki bar in the “Niederdörfli” quarter has been delighting a mixed public with music and a laid-back atmosphere since 1955.

places.name: bQm Kulturcafe & Bar
places.description: Every student in Zurich is familiar with the student bar below the Polyterrasse, for it is a highly popular meeting place.

places.name: Mäx Zürich
places.description: In the place where in earlier times cogwheels were hardened, now turntables turn – the Mäx is housed in an old factory in Zürich-West.

places.name: Bananenreiferei
places.description: The factory where for 50 years bananas were left to ripen is now a place for dancing, celebrating, feasting, holding meetings and much more.

places.name: 2. Akt Restaurant & Bar
places.description: Whether for coffee, lunch, or an after-work drink: this locale offers something for everyone. And thanks to the DJs, music lovers and dance enthusiasts also feel at home.

places.name: 4. Akt Restaurant & Bar
places.description: From a morning coffee to a relaxed lunch to a fun after-work drink – the 4. Akt is a lively locale with an out-of-the-ordinary ambiance.

places.name: Big Ben Westside
places.description: In this pub in the buzzing Zurich-West quarter, fans of TV sport transmissions and rock music will find a second home.

places.name: Big Ben Pub
places.description: Just like a pub should be: a good selection of drinks, some tasty snacks, and sport transmissions broadcast on TV screens.

places.name: Stubä
places.description: The restaurant in the heart of Zurich’s Langstrasse quarter has hit the right nerve: in cozy, unpretentious surroundings, it serves the best steak sandwich in town.

places.name: Splendid Piano Bar & Smoking Lounge
places.description: For decades, the Splendid Piano Bar has been treating its eclectic mix of clientele to cocktails and live music in the heart of Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Olé Olé Bar
places.description: One of the most legendary bars in the city is located in the heart of the Langstrasse quarter.

places.name: Supermarket
places.description: Supermarket pioneered nightlife in Zürich-West and is a popular meeting place for fans of electronic music.

places.name: Kanzlei
places.description: Virtually every Zurich resident has been to the Kanzlei Club directly on Langstrasse.

places.name: Komplex 457
places.description: In this former industrial hall in the west of Zurich, mainly rock, heavy metal, and pop concerts thrill a broad audience.

places.name: Hive
places.description: As one of Zurich‘s most established clubs, the Hive offers a colorful yet stringent electronic music program.

places.name: Palais Mascotte
places.description: Zurich’s oldest club, the Palais Mascotte, is still bursting with energy despite its 100 years of age.

places.name: Vinobar il Sottoscala
places.description: At the Sottoscala, guests enjoy Italian culinary classics directly on the shore of Lake Zurich.

places.name: The Lion Pub
places.description: Situated not far from the busy Bahnhofstrasse, the Lion Pub has a real British feel.

places.name: Plan b
places.description: The large and cozy lounge bar directly next to Winterthur Train Station. Perfect for after-work drinks or a lunchtime break.

places.name: Nachtflug
places.description: Located in the heart of the Old Town and with access to a secluded courtyard, this bar is a great place to relax and enjoy yourself.

places.name: Longstreet
places.description: Red plush fabric on the walls and many, many light bulbs: the bar on Langstrasse is an absolute institution in Zurich’s nightlife scene.

places.name: Dieci Bar
places.description: Dieci Restaurants on the Rapperswil Seequai. Atmospheric bar in the well-known friendly Dieci tradition. Pane, amore e fantasia!

places.name: Plaza Klub
places.description: The building that once housed Zurich’s first movie theater is now a popular place to dance – at parties as well as at live concerts.

places.name: Kasheme
places.description: Kasheme is a retro-style living room, musical adventure, and trendy disco all in one.

places.name: X-tra
places.description: An institution among Zurich’s nightlife venues with popular theme parties and concerts.

places.name: Sport Bar
places.description: The bar in a side street off Langstrasse is a favorite haunt among the Kreis 4 creative scene – and serves great coffee and delicious cocktails.

places.name: Piccolo Giardino
places.description: The name is misleading: the terrace of the Piccolo Giardino (“small garden” in Italian) is at least as big as the heart of this neighborhood bar.

places.name: Mars Bar
places.description: Just off Langstrasse, a small bar has stood its ground against all the changes in the neighborhood: the Mars Bar is and remains a cozy meeting place.

places.name: Züri Bar
places.description: The history-steeped bar now offers a concentrated dose of Italianità ‒ in the form of food and drink, authentic and simple.

places.name: Bar Xenix
places.description: An oasis in the heart of the bustling Kreis 4 district – for mild summer nights and cozy movie evenings.

places.name: Dynamo
places.description: The Dynamo youth cultural center hosts concerts and parties for people of all ages.

places.name: Hotel Bar
places.description: The reception area of what used to be a sleazy hotel that was booked by the hour has now been transformed into a bar for long, convivial nights.

places.name: Hafenkneipe
places.description: Not just for sea dogs and sailors – everyone is welcome at the Hafenkneipe.

places.name: Bar 63
places.description: The bar for one and all: here everyone feels at home.

places.name: Eldorado
places.description: Zurich’s El Dorado for beer lovers is located at Limmatplatz.

places.name: Binz & Kunz
places.description: An urban city oasis in the heart of Zurich’s buzzing Binz quarter.

places.name: Cinchona Bar
places.description: Lovers of so-called “highballs” can enjoy these delicious cocktails in a casual atmosphere in the Cinchona Bar, housed in the 25hours Hotel Langstrasse.

places.name: Houdini Bar
places.description: No doubt the wide selection of newspapers attracts some visitors. But it seems a shame to fix your eyes on paper amidst such a fantastic ambiance.

places.name: Franzos
places.description: Small but first-rate – that sums up this French-style restaurant in a nutshell. With its central location, it is the ideal place for a relaxing break.

places.name: Meyer’s
places.description: Meyer’s is a legendary bar near Lochergut, just a few minutes from Langstrasse.

places.name: Kleine Freiheit
places.description: The Kleine Freiheit in Zurich’s Kreis 6 district enchants visitors from near and far with its charming garden restaurant and frill-free culinary delicacies.

places.name: Calvados
places.description: The Calvados is a sports bar, summer terrace, beer specialty locale, meeting place for after-work drinks and occasionally a disco, all in one.

places.name: Helsinki
places.description: The band and audience celebrate here equally: the locale is intimate and personal – and the music live and of top quality.

places.name: Plüsch
places.description: The cozy Plüsch café-bar in the heart of the Wiedikon quarter has a living room-feel and is very popular with locals and guests alike.

places.name: Kafisatz
places.description: People of all ages convene at the Kafisatz restaurant, in the heart of Winterthur's Old Town, at any time of day.

places.name: El Lokal
places.description: Music lovers, soccer fans, and anyone seeking a place to relax will find the “very last island on the Sihl” between Gessnerallee and the River Sihl.

places.name: Rote Fabrik
places.description: The alternative cultural center on Lake Zurich, where stars such as Nirvana and Red Hot Chili Peppers have performed, can look back on an eventful history – and forward to an exciting future.

places.name: Berta Bar
places.description: The small bar directly on Idaplatz is a popular meeting place for residents and guests from all over the world. There is always something going on here.

places.name: Barfussbar
places.description: One of the most popular “Badi” bars among Zurich residents is the Barfussbar, offering a view of the Grossmünster, Fraumünster, and the River Limmat.

places.name: Bar Si o No
places.description: The popular bar near Wiedikon Train Station is always worth a visit.

places.name: Lenox Bar
places.description: The bar at the Marriott Hotel invites guests on a trip to New York.

places.name: Altstadtbar
places.description: Centrally located in the Old Town and yet never hectic: the pretty Altstadt Bar invites guests to linger and relax.

places.name: 67 Sportsbar
places.description: Located directly at the Bossard Arena ice sports center, this bar is the destination for ice hockey fans and all those who want to watch various sports events live on TV.

places.name: Total Bar
places.description: Like the Gallic village of “Asterix and Obelix” fame, for 20 years this bar has withstood all the many changes going on around it. Which is good news for fans of the relaxed bar culture.

places.name: Kronenhalle Bar
places.description: There is hardly a more history-steeped and sophisticated bar in Zurich: at Bellevue, guests enjoy drinks in an elegant atmosphere surrounded by art and artists.

places.name: Pelikanbar
places.description: A locale with many faces: a café in the morning, a bistro during the day, and a bar in the evening.

places.name: Alte Kaserne
places.description: Whether party, concert, theater, or dancing: the Alte Kaserne in the middle of the Kasernenareal can stage everything.

places.name: Tales Bar
places.description: Here, where even bartenders meet for a drink after work, the quality of the cocktails is excellent.

places.name: Jade Club
places.description: See and be seen: the Jade club is characterized by its VIP lounges and exclusive parties.

places.name: Lima Bar
places.description: A pleasant ambiance, a great location, and an ambitious barkeeper: this cocktail bar has it all.

places.name: Old Crow
places.description: Rare spirits and excellent cocktails in a small bar in the heart of the Old Town – for connoisseurs and anyone who wants to become one.

places.name: Vior
places.description: Central location and a sophisticated ambiance for people who takes clubbing very seriously.

places.name: Grand Café Lochergut
places.description: Cardamom coffee and arak cocktails: the selection at the Grand Café Lochergut is anything but boring.

places.name: Konrad
places.description: Whether as the first stop after arriving at Zurich Main Station or the last one before heading home – here the coffee tastes just as good as the cocktails.

places.name: Klaus
places.description: The “Klaus” is not a member’s club, but rather a club for friends and friends of friends.

places.name: Café Lang
places.description: Limmatplatz is not only the place where tram and bus lines cross – it is also a gastronomic hub.

places.name: Fat Tony
places.description: The perfect place for the start – and the end – of a long evening on Langstrasse.

places.name: Acid
places.description: A small and cozy meeting-place on Langstrasse where you can get everything from a coffee to a nightcap.

places.name: Petra’s Tip Top Bar
places.description: The popular pop music bar at Seilergraben is just a stone‘s throw from Central.

places.name: Grande Café & Bar
places.description: Guests enjoy good coffee, delicious drinks, and light snacks in this little café on the Limmatquai.

places.name: Regenbogen Bar
places.description: “Rägebögli” or “Bögli,” as it is also known, lies in the heart of the Old Town and is one of Zurich’s classic bars.

places.name: Heaven Club
places.description: Heaven is a dance and night club in the heart of Zurich’s Old Town. Renowned as a LGBTQIA+ club, it is a very popular venue among heterosexuals, too.

places.name: Aelpli Bar
places.description: The much-loved and legendary Aelpli Bar is tucked away in a backstreet in the heart of the Niederdorf, an area of Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Club Bellevue
places.description: This small but select club directly by the tram junction at Bellevue, in the very heart of the city, is a popular meeting place among night owls.

places.name: Aya Drinx & Talx
places.description: The cozy Aya Bar lies directly next to the Abaton movie theater. However, it is much more than just a meeting place for movie-goers.

places.name: The Studio Café-Bar
places.description: The Studio accommodates a radio studio that broadcasts live every day, together with a café. An impressive experience not only for radio enthusiasts.

places.name: IQ Bar
places.description: Anyone who likes choice wines, rare whiskeys and carefully mixed drinks will love it here.

places.name: Frau Gerolds Winterstube and Winter-Garten
places.description: A cozy ambiance, tasty fondues, and a lively atmosphere – that is what characterizes Frau Gerolds Garten during the winter months.

places.name: Lucid Bar – Renaissance Zurich Tower Hotel
places.description: From morning to night, this hotel bar is a great place to linger – during the day it is quiet and relaxing, in the evening lively.

places.name: Löwen Weiningen
places.description: In Weiningen, the Löwen restaurant with its village character invites guests to enjoy good old Swiss cuisine.

places.name: St. Joseph‘s Pub
places.description: In the heart of Zurich, yet almost like in England: a traditional pub with tasty food and a great atmosphere.

places.name: Old Gregory Pub
places.description: In the Langstrasse quarter, there is a cozy pub that does not just cater to the needs of sports fans.

places.name: Gräbli Bar
places.description: This bar enjoys cult status: here guests are welcome almost 24/7, 365 days a year, and encounter a colorful mix of guests.

places.name: Gainsbourg
places.description: A bar with warmth, style and attention to detail. For convivial get-togethers or lively celebrations in relaxed and friendly surroundings.

places.name: Onyx Bar
places.description: The Onyx Bar is characterized by its extensive selection of spirits and cocktails.

places.name: Hotel Rivington & Sons
places.description: Fancy a drink in New York? On the ground floor of the Prime Tower in Zürich, you get a real taste of the Big Apple.

places.name: • • • Rooftop Restaurant
places.description: The Rooftop Bar at the top of the tradition-steeped fashion store, Modissa, serves up cool drinks, creative cuisine, and a wonderful view.

places.name: Bierhalle Wolf
places.description: Live music, draught beer, and a lively party atmosphere: this is what awaits guests at the Bierhalle Wolf, in the heart of Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Gonzo Club
places.description: The ambiance at the Gonzo Club on Zurich’s Langstrasse is alternative, loud, and laid-back.

places.name: Vagabundo
places.description: Spanish ambiance and great music can be found at the Vagabundo in Zurich-West – or “Oeste”, as the Spanish call it.

places.name: Bar/Café Cabaret Voltaire
places.description: An absolute must for culture fans: it is here that Hugo Ball and Emmy Hennings started the Dada movement.

places.name: Nuovo
places.description: Besides coffee specialties, the Café & Bar Nuovo offers a selection of wines and cocktails, as well as tasty Italian cuisine.

places.name: Plaza Bar
places.description: This ambiance-steeped, cozy cocktail bar lies directly on the corner of the lively Langstrasse and is the perfect place to kick off a long night in the buzzing Kreis 4 quarter.

places.name: Swiss Casinos Pfäffikon-Zürichsee
places.description: Gaming, fun and culinary delights at Swiss Casinos Pfäffikon-Zürichsee

places.name: George Bar & Grill
places.description: At the George Bar & Grill, guests are surrounded by pure elegance. The penthouse restaurant serves food, long drinks, and wine with dignified charm.

places.name: Mehrspur Music Club
places.description: The Mehrspur is a concert venue, jam arena, laboratory, bar, and discotheque ‒ in short, a platform for the Zurich University of the Arts (ZHdK) to showcase the talents of tomorrow.

places.name: Grand Casino Baden
places.description: Open 365 days a year, the casino in Baden offers a variety of entertainment and gaming fun.

places.name: Kiosk
places.description: Located in Riesbach harbor in Zurich’s Seefeld quarter, the Kiosk treats its guests to a varied selection of dishes.

places.name: Moods
places.description: The top address in Zurich for jazz, funk, soul, and blues convinces with a high caliber program.

places.name: Exil
places.description: Carefully curated concerts and parties featuring national and international bands and DJs.

places.name: Bar Le Philosophe
places.description: In a somewhat hidden-away location is the attractive bar, Le Philosophe, where guests can enjoy cocktails, wines, and also delicious steak tartare.

places.name: Widder Bar
places.description: The successful reinterpretation of Zurich’s legendary Widder Bar impresses with its stylish interior and high quality.

places.name: Weinschenke Hirschen
places.description: Romantic hours are guaranteed in this medieval vaulted cellar.

places.name: Tina Bar
places.description: The cult restaurant in the heart of Zurich’s Old Town is a meeting place for lovers of cocktails, wine, and interior design.

places.name: Sphères
places.description: Enjoy a coffee while browsing through selected literature ‒ what better place to do this than at the popular Sphères, on the banks of the River Limmat.

places.name: Red L
places.description: At the Löwen restaurant in Meilen, guests can spend a few relaxing hours in pleasant company in the Red L bar.

places.name: Rathaus Café
places.description: One of the city’s most beautiful sun terraces can be found at the Rathaus Café on Limmatquai.

places.name: Predigerhof
places.description: The small bar directly opposite the Central Library is a popular meeting place in the Old Town.

places.name: Lago Lounge
places.description: The lounge located directly at Lachen marina is the perfect place for a short break at any time of the day.

places.name: Goethe Bar
places.description: Located directly next to the Opera House and on Sechseläutenplatz, the Goethe Bar is the perfect place to switch off and relax.

places.name: Rimini Bar
places.description: Zürich is renowned for its bathing pool bars or Badi-Bars. At dusk, the lakeside and riverside pools are transformed into sophisticated bars and lounges directly by the water.

places.name: Casino Zürich
places.description: Switzerland’s largest casino delights a wide public in the heart of the city of Zurich.

places.name: Stall 6
places.description: The cultural center is a popular meeting place for creative entertainment – from concerts and comedy shows to “castings” for people looking for or offering a room in a shared apartment.

places.name: Barfüsser Sushi Bar & Lounge
places.description: The Barfüsser was one of the first sushi restaurants in Zurich. To this day, it is distinguished by its competence in making sushi dishes.

places.name: Stazione Paradiso
places.description: The popular open-air bar on the River Limmat has long since ceased to be an insider tip.

places.name: Restaurant & Bar Seebad Enge
places.description: During the day a lakeside swimming pool, in the evening a bar serving refreshing drinks and home-made summer cuisine.

places.name: Rio Bar Express Buffet
places.description: Situated between Zurich Main Station, the casino, and the Langstrasse quarter, the Rio Bar is the perfect place to enjoy a short break.

places.name: Kafischnaps
places.description: The Kafischnaps, located between the Wipkingen and Unterstrass quarters, spoils its guests with homemade delicacies.

places.name: Jules Verne Panorama Bar
places.description: In the heart of the city, guests can enjoy one of the most spectacular views over the rooftops of Zurich, Lake Zurich, and as far as the Alps.

places.name: Frau Gerolds Garten
places.description: The feel-good oasis at the foot of the Prime Tower: here, visitors can find tiny stores, art, a garden community, and a vibrant program of events within the smallest of spaces.

places.name: Cranberry Bar
places.description: One of the most legendary and best-known gay bars in Zurich.

places.name: Collana Bar e Caffè
places.description: Situated in the middle of the Sechseläutenplatz square, the Collana invites guests to linger and indulge themselves.

places.name: Bauschänzli Biergarten & Grill
places.description: The “Bauschänzli” is Zurich’s very own miniature island – with a cozy beer garden under large chestnut trees.

places.name: Goodys Smashburger
places.description: Freshly minced meat, crispy fries and creamy cheese – the ultimate smash burger treat.

places.name: Bill’s Burger
places.description: Juicy burgers and hot sandwiches in Zurich West for a perfect lunch break.

places.name: Burgermeister
places.description: Tender and juicy, bursting with flavor, and available in many variations: the Burgermeister leaves nothing to be desired.

places.name: 8304 | Altes Feuerwehrgebäude
places.description: A club sandwich, burger, or tarte flambée accompanied by a cool beer or a good-quality wine: that is the way to wind down in Wallisellen after a hard day at work.

places.name: Public Burger Sihlcity
places.description: The upper and under side beautifully brown and crispy, soft inside, tender, and mouth-wateringly succulent – the burgers served at Public Burger at Sihlcity are nothing short of perfection.

places.name: Papa Joe’s Restaurant & Bar
places.description: A restaurant for culinary globetrotters in the heart of Zurich.

places.name: Roots
places.description: A vegan restaurant with a cool, urban, casual vibe: that is Roots, located between Zurich Main Station and Löwenplatz.

places.name: k2 Bistro & Bar
places.description: In the trendy Zürich-West quarter, the cozy k2 Bistro and Bar at the foot of the Prime Tower welcomes both local and international guests in a relaxed and urban atmosphere.

places.name: Equinox Restaurant
places.description: Under the motto, “From Zurich into the World”, the Equinox promises a culinary journey from Swiss classics to international delicacies.

places.name: N-68
places.description: Guests can enjoy frill-free cuisine in this restaurant with bar, located just a stone’s throw from Central.

places.name: Boom
places.description: The Restaurant Boom is a friendly family restaurant housed in the Hotel Ibis in Zurich-Adliswil.

places.name: Mt. Pilatus in Summer
places.description: Delight in the view, breathe in the mountain air and engage in one of the many opportunities to be active – spend a great day in Central Switzerland.

places.name: The Goldinger Valley
places.description: The leisure paradise of the Goldinger valley is just an hour’s journey from Zurich, and offers a host of experiences for sport enthusiasts and nature lovers.

places.name: Flumserberg in Summer – a Hiking Paradise on the Walensee
places.description: Flumserberg can be reached from Zurich within just 40 minutes. This popular mountain holds countless experiences and magnificent views in store for visitors.

places.name: Atzmännig Family Paradise – Rope Park, Toboggan Run, Leisure Park and Hiking
places.description: The Atzmännig is a leisure paradise and popular excursion for families with children.

places.name: Main Building of the ETH Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich
places.description: The main building of the ETH Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich stands on a hill overlooking Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: MFO-Park
places.description: In the place where the machine factory, Maschinenfabrik Oerlikon (MFO), once stood, an architecturally fascinating “park hall” bears witness to the past usage of the site.

places.name: Hunziker Areal
places.description: Standing on the site of what used to be the Hunziker cement factory is the fascinating urban development project, Hunziker Areal, which particularly enthralls architecture lovers.

places.name: Zurich University of the Arts (ZHdK), Toni Campus
places.description: The Toni Campus, on the site of an old dairy, has been occupied by Zurich University of the Arts since 2014.

places.name: Extension to the Swiss National Museum
places.description: The Swiss National Museum is a particular highlight for architecture enthusiasts. It is a meeting place for two architectural epochs that could scarcely be more different.

places.name: Student Village, Science City ETH Zurich
places.description: This student residence is a real eye-catcher. It is also the first residential complex in Zurich to be built right on campus.

places.name: UB Law, University of Zurich
places.description: This architectural masterpiece is located in the heart of the Faculty of Law.

places.name: Leutschenbach School
places.description: The prize-winning Leutschenbach School stands out for its structural and architectural finesse.

places.name: K.I.S.S., Badenerstrasse
places.description: This building with its playful windows is striking, even from afar. But there’s even more behind them.

places.name: Cassiopeia Boardwalk
places.description: The Cassiopeia boardwalk enables pedestrians and joggers to follow a route all the way along the left bank of Lake Zurich without interruption.

places.name: Regensberg Castle
places.description: Regensberg Castle was once the ancestral seat of the House of Regensberg.

places.name: Schloss Laufen – the 1000-Year-Old Castle by the Rhine Falls
places.description: A medieval castle on a rocky spur and roaring masses of water: the Rhine Falls and Schloss Laufen near Schaffhausen treat visitors to an impressive sight.

places.name: Europaallee Master Plan
places.description: Located parallel to the tracks of Zurich Main Station, the overall architectural concept creates new spaces for leisure activities, education, living and working.

places.name: Europaallee – Shopping, Relaxation and Enjoyment in the Heart of Zurich
places.description: Europaallee, situated immediately next to Zurich Main Train Station, is the newest of the city’s neighborhoods and a vibrant mix of shopping, culture, restaurants and bars.

places.name: Chinese Garden
places.description: The Chinese Garden is classed as a temple garden and is one of the highest-ranking gardens outside of China.

places.name: Plan Lumière – the Lights of Zurich City
places.description: Plan Lumière – a lighting design concept by which Zurich also shines at night.

places.name: Rapperswil-Hurden Wooden Bridge – a Walkway Across Lake Zurich
places.description: On the bridge between Rapperswil and Hurden you find yourself walking in the footsteps of pilgrims.

places.name: Freitag Tower
places.description: These stacked shipping containers in Zurich-West are a treat for urban explorers and fans of Freitag bags alike.

places.name: Pavillon Le Corbusier
places.description: The last work by the great architect, Le Corbusier, stands in a beautiful location on Lake Zurich.

places.name: Custorhaus in Eschenbach
places.description: The Custorhaus in Eschenbach looks back on an eventful history. Today it is a cultural venue.

places.name: Stadelhofen Station
places.description: In the busy heart of Zurich, you’ll find one of the first projects of star architect Santiago Calatrava.

places.name: Prime Tower
places.description: The Prime Tower is fast joining the Grossmünster church in the ranks of Zurich landmarks.

places.name: Vögele Cultural Center
places.description: An exceptional architectural monument from the 70s houses the Vögele Cultural Center. It is based in Pfäffikon on Lake Zurich.

places.name: Giacometti Frescos (“Blüemlihalle”)
places.description: Thanks to Augusto Giacometti, what is probably the most beautiful police station entrance hall worldwide is located in the heart of Zurich.

places.name: Zürich-West
places.description: From industrial quarter to trendy district: Zurich-West is full of contrasts, boasting an unpolished charm.

places.name: City Hall
places.description: The city and canton parliaments meet in Zurich's Rathaus (city hall) – forming a unique style-mix in Switzerland.

places.name: Grossmünster
places.description: Zurich’s Famous Landmark.

places.name: Freiruum Zug
places.description: With a market hall, boulder area, parkour zone, trampoline park, and kids’ corner, the Freiruum is one of the largest concepts for temporary use in Switzerland.

places.name: Milandia
places.description: The sports and adventure park operated by the Swiss retail company, Migros, is a popular excursion destination for families, sports enthusiasts, and people seeking relaxation.

places.name: Chäserrugg in Summer
places.description: On the Chäserrugg, walkers, hikers and anyone seeking peace and quiet can enjoy an unspoilt Alpine world – complete with breathtaking views.

places.name: Mt. Titlis – a Hiking Paradise in Summer
places.description: The 3,020m (9,908 ft) high Mt. Titlis is one of the most popular excursion destinations in Central Switzerland.

places.name: Stoos-Fronalpstock in Summer
places.description: This region offers numerous possibilities for hikers of all ages. But those who do not feel like spending the day walking are also well catered for.

places.name: Rigi in Summer
places.description: The enchanting mountain in Central Switzerland is ideal for a day trip: the Rigi offers a host of options for both young and old.

places.name: Mythen in Summer
places.description: In the Mythen region, virtually no wish is left unfulfilled.

places.name: Zugerberg
places.description: The Zugerberg mountain is an ideal excursion destination for nature lovers and sports enthusiasts all year round.

places.name: Minimum Bouldering Gym
places.description: The Minimum is a boulder climbing hall, covering an area of 8,600 sq.ft and with over 200 continually changing boulder challenges.

places.name: Braunwald in Glarnerland – a Hiking Area and Family Paradise
places.description: Braunwald is located at 4,120ft (1,256m) altitude and is the ideal starting point for exploring the mountain world.

places.name: Atzmännig Rope Adventure Park
places.description: The Atzmännig Rope Adventure Park offers an adrenaline rush for all the family at a lofty height.

places.name: «Der ungezähmte Horizont» by Yves Netzhammer
places.description: Yves Netzhammer’s thought-provoking kinetic sculpture in Zurich’s district 5 surprises and moves its viewers.

places.name: Tableau Zurich
places.description: Tableau Zurich is an open-air art gallery that is accessible by the public 365 days a year.

places.name: Lichthalle MAAG
places.description: Illuminated and animated art set to music enthralls a broad public in Zürich-West.

places.name: Placart
places.description: The gallery for Original Posters and the artistic oeuvre of the artist, Le Corbusier.

places.name: “La Boule d’or centenaire” by Dieter Meier
places.description: The gold-plated century ball by Dieter Meier, frontman of the Swiss pop band, Yello, is deposited in the ground at Zurich Main Station.

places.name: “Anne-Sophie” by Alex Hanimann
places.description: From its position in front of the 25hours hotel in Zürich-West, the chrome steel sculpture by artist Alex Hanimann shines and reflects its surroundings.

places.name: “Towers” by Los Carpinteros
places.description: Situated on Escher-Wyss-Platz, the artwork, “Towers”, by Los Carpinteros pays homage to the former industrial quarter.

places.name: “How to Work Better” by Fischli/Weiss
places.description: Observant travelers can discover an important artwork by the Zurich artist duo, Fischli/Weiss, painted on the side of a building in Oerlikon.

places.name: “Y” by Sislej Xhafa
places.description: Located in Hardau Park in the western part of Zurich, this installation invites people to ponder on its various meanings.

places.name: Art Space Guide – Alternative Off Spaces in Zurich
places.description: The Art Space Guide lists the locations of artist-run exhibition spaces – also known as off spaces – in Zurich.

places.name: Löwenbräukunst-Areal – Art Center
places.description: From a brewery to an art complex: this renovated brick building from 1897 now houses several art institutions and galleries.

places.name: Cabaret Voltaire
places.description: Hugo Ball and Emmy Hennings founded the Cabaret Voltaire in the middle of Zurich’s Old Town in 1916. It was here that Dada was born.

places.name: Shedhalle – Critical Art in Zurich
places.description: Activity space and showroom in the grounds of the Rote Fabrik, directly on the shores of Lake Zurich.

places.name: Kunst Museum Winterthur – Reinhart am Stadtgarten
places.description: Located at Winterthur’s Stadtgarten, the museum features artwork from the Romanticism and Realism eras in the German-speaking world.

places.name: Oskar Reinhart Collection “Am Römerholz” in Winterthur
places.description: Renoir, Manet and Cézanne are just some of the names featured at the “Am Römerholz” villa. The Winterthur museum also includes some old masters.

places.name: Museum Rietberg – Art From all Over the World
places.description: Set amidst one of the most beautiful parks in Zurich, the Museum Rietberg houses works of art from outside Europe.

places.name: Museum Haus Konstruktiv
places.description: The Museum Haus Konstruktiv is the leading institution for constructivist, concrete, and conceptual art in Switzerland.

places.name: Musée Visionnaire
places.description: Situated in the heart of Zurich‘s Old Town, the Musée Visionnaire offers a platform for Art Brut and Outsider Art.

places.name: Migros Museum of Contemporary Art
places.description: The Migros Museum for Contemporary Art deliberately breaks with tried and tested tradition: by creating open space for art at Zurich's Löwenbräu-Areal.

places.name: Kunst Museum Winterthur
places.description: The Kunst Museum Winterthur unites three different museums under one umbrella brand and impresses with its wonderful collection.

places.name: Kunsthaus Zürich
places.description: Switzerland's largest art museum inspires with its light-flooded extension by David Chipperfield, as well as with one of the most important collections of art in the country.

places.name: Kunsthaus Zug – From Viennese Modernism to Swiss Surrealism
places.description: The collection of the Kunsthaus Zug (art museum) comprises works ranging from classical Modernism to modern art.

places.name: Kunsthalle Zurich
places.description: The Kunsthalle in Zürich-West is one of the most exciting cultural institutions for international contemporary art.

places.name: Helmhaus Zürich – an Exhibition Space for Swiss Contemporary Art
places.description: The Helmhaus is located on the right-hand banks of the River Limmat in Zurich’s old town. Its temporary exhibitions reflect the lively art scene in Switzerland.

places.name: Graphics Collection of the ETH Zurich
places.description: With around 150,000 printed graphic works, from the 15th century until the present day, the Graphics Collection of the ETH Zurich is the largest of its kind in Switzerland.

places.name: Studio Restaurant, Bar & Club
places.description: Japanese “tapas”, live music, club nights, and good cocktails: Studio Bar is a deservedly popular venue in Zurich’s District 5.

places.name: Restaurant Chimy’s
places.description: Located not far from Langstrasse, Chimy's offers an all-you-can-eat buffet featuring vegetarian and vegan Asian dishes.

places.name: Ooki Japanese Pavillon
places.description: Guests will find authentic Japanese dishes, as well as a large selection of sake, directly next to the Letzigrund Stadium.

places.name: Restaurant LO!
places.description: Simple yet of top quality, this restaurant on Lake Zurich celebrates pan-Asian cuisine.

places.name: La Muña Restaurant
places.description: Perched on the sixth floor of La Réserve Eden au Lac, the La Muña restaurant treats guests to a 360° view of Zurich.

places.name: Restaurant Angkor
places.description: In the Zürich-West quarter, guests at the Angkor restaurant embark on a culinary journey through the whole of Asia.

places.name: Miss Miu
places.description: This pan asian restaurant welcomes guests on Europaallee, close to the Main Train Station.

places.name: Ginger – Restaurant & Sake Bar
places.description: Ginger is a Japanese restaurant with a sushi bar, à la carte service, and a sake bar, and is located in Zurich’s Seefeld quarter.

places.name: Edomae
places.description: Culinary enjoyment in 15 courses – for all those who enjoy surprises and want to be enchanted by a broad variety of flavors.

places.name: Nooch Asian Kitchen
places.description: Steamed noodles or fresh sushi: here you can find the very best of Asian street food.

places.name: Negishi Sushi Bar Niederdorf
places.description: A small oasis of Japanese cuisine in the heart of Zurich‘s Old Town – the perfect place for lovers of bentos and modern sushi creations.

places.name: Himmapan Lodge
places.description: Himmapan Lodge, with its Asian-style design, is situated in a beautiful location overlooking the lake and treats guests to authentic Thai delicacies.

places.name: Co Chin Chin
places.description: At the restaurant, Co Chin Chin, guests can find a little piece of Vietnam in the heart of the lively Langstrasse quarter.

places.name: Vee’s Bistro
places.description: Thai food at its best in the heart of Zurich’s business and banking district.

places.name: Wesley’s Kitchen
places.description: When Chinese tradition meets the modern world, the result is a multi-faceted cuisine that has its roots in China and finds its inspiration all over the world.

places.name: Ikoo
places.description: Small but select: the ramen restaurant, Ikoo, located between Stauffacher and Langstrasse, delights its guests with Japanese noodle dishes.

places.name: Giesserei Oerlikon
places.description: Post-industrial charm merges with culinary delights: The authentic and innovative cuisine served at the Giesserei Oerlikon wins gourmets’ hearts with seasonal treats.

places.name: Malabar
places.description: Opposite the Hallenstadion Zurich, food lovers can enjoy innovative cuisine from South India.

places.name: Chinagarten Take Away
places.description: Set in the wall surrounding the beautiful Chinese Garden is the Chinagarten Take Away.

places.name: Saigon
places.description: At the Saigon, guests embark on a culinary journey through Vietnam in the heart of Zurich.

places.name: Sonnenberg Viewpoint
places.description: This stunning viewpoint offers a fabulous view over Lake Zurich, the Uetliberg, and the city – and yet, visitors are in with a good chance of having it all to themselves.

places.name: Jungfraujoch with the Zürich Card
places.description: With the Zürich Card, guests benefit from 15% discount on the amazing mountain adventure to the Jungfraujoch – Top of Europe.

places.name: Orelliweg
places.description: If you follow this path between the top station of the Rigiblick funicular and Zurich Zoo, you will always have a great view over the city.

places.name: Bronze City Model on Stadthausquai
places.description: A model of Zurich that you can touch: directly next to the Stadthaus, both visually impaired and sighted people can feel the city center with their fingers.

places.name: Polybahn
places.description: The “Polybähnli” is one of the most legendary modes of transportation in Zurich. The nostalgic little train is not just cute, but also convenient.

places.name: Enge Church
places.description: Enge Church is already visible from a distance. Visitors entering its dome are treated to a magnificent view over Zurich.

places.name: Sihlfeld Cemetery
places.description: The central cemetery is both the largest resting place for the dead and the largest continuous green space in the city.

places.name: Archaeological Windows
places.description: Archaeological windows provide a glimpse into Zurich’s past.

places.name: Cloister (Grossmünster)
places.description: An oasis of peace in the heart of the Old Town – the cloister of the Grossmünster is (still) an insider tip.

places.name: Winterthur
places.description: Situated to the north of Zurich, Winterthur enthralls with music, art, and culture.

places.name: Memorial to Hans Künzi by Carsten Höller
places.description: A memorial to Hans Künzi, the “Father of the S-Bahn”, is installed at Europaplatz next to Zurich Main Station, honoring his services in an abstract manner.

places.name: “Der Gefangene Floh” by Yves Netzhammer
places.description: In the ewz power substation in the industrial quarter of Oerlikon, a huge perceptual labyrinth provides insights into a subterranean world.

places.name: Archaeological Window at the Parkhaus Opéra
places.description: The archaeological remains of prehistoric pile dwellings next to Zurich’s Sechseläutenplatz feature on UNESCO’s World Heritage List.

places.name: St. Annahof Märlitram
places.description: For children, the best way to enjoy Advent is on a trip in the "Märlitram". Angels read their young passengers Christmas stories while the festively decorated streetcar trundles through the city.

places.name: Rapperswil Castle
places.description: Rapperswil Castle is the landmark of the “Town of Roses”, situated on Lake Zurich.

places.name: Nature Reserve and Wildlife Park Goldau
places.description: Sika deer, mouflon and Syrian brown bear: at Goldau Zoo, young explorers can observe their favorite animals close up.

places.name: Hegi Castle
places.description: Visitors to Hegi Castle can enjoy vegetable varieties from bygone days, which are also grown here.

places.name: Zurich Oberland Steam Train
places.description: Every Sunday from spring to fall, railroad fans can undertake a trip on one of the historical trains operated by the Zurich Oberland Steam Train Association.

places.name: Morgarten Trail
places.description: Along this fun-packed trail, young knights can follow the trail of the legendary Battle of Morgarten.

places.name: The Guggi Vantage Point in Zug – Offering a View over the Old Town and Lake Zug
places.description: On an excursion to Zug, you should be sure not to miss this magnificent view over the Old Town and Lake Zug.

places.name: Hiking from Winterthur to Rapperswil – Züri Oberland-Höhenweg
places.description: The trail leads from Winterthur through a beautiful pre-Alpine hiking area with rugged valleys, lakes and ridges with wonderful views.

places.name: Limmat River Cruise
places.description: A boat trip on the River Limmat will take you on a leisurely tour past the most beautiful sights that Zurich’s Old Town has to offer until the view opens up over Lake Zurich.

places.name: Zug – Small and Compact
places.description: The small town of Zug, which lies to the south of Zurich, enchants with its charming Old Town and lake.

places.name: Observation Decks at Zurich Airport
places.description: Experience the world of aviation close up.

places.name: "Chänzeli" Tour
places.description: The historically based "Chänzeli" Tour is a 6-mile long panoromic city hike around Baden.

places.name: Sechseläutenplatz – Combines Tradition With Modernity
places.description: Sechseläutenplatz is a place for relaxing between Bellevue and Zurich's Opera House.

places.name: Einsiedeln Abbey
places.description: For many pilgrims, Einsiedeln Abbey is one of the most important places of pilgrimage on the Swiss Way of St. James.

places.name: Viadukt Arches
places.description: Zurich’s railway viaduct offers unique space for a trendy shopping and cultural district.

places.name: Rindermarkt (Cattle Market) – Where Gottfried Keller Grew Up
places.description: The house where Gottfried Keller lived as a boy, the "Öpfelchammer" and a very picturesque Zurich are located at Rindermarkt (Cattle Market).

places.name: The Erlengut  – a Stately Home on Lake Zurich
places.description: The Erlengut is a romantic manor house with views of Lake Zurich.

places.name: Rennweg
places.description: Once the widest street in Zurich, Rennweg is now a popular promenade in the heart of the Old Town.

places.name: Ritterhaus and Chapel, Uerikon
places.description: In Uerikon by Lake Zurich you can trace the footsteps of the old knights.

places.name: Paradeplatz
places.description: At the heart of Bahnhofstrasse lies Paradeplatz, a square famous for its leading financial institutions and the traditional confectionery house Sprüngli.

places.name: Rapperswil – Picturesque Town of Roses by Lake Zurich
places.description: Roses shape the townscape in picturesque Rapperswil.

places.name: Niederdorf – Popular Promenade in Zurich's Old Town
places.description: Niederdorf offers interesting sights, culinary delights and shopping in Zurich's old town.

places.name: Castle Tower Pfäffikon SZ
places.description: It is well worth taking a glimpse inside the old walls of the Schlossturm in Pfäffikon am Zürichsee.

places.name: Schipfe – Zurich’s Oldest District
places.description: Boats docked at "Schipfe" in the Middle Ages, which delivered silk, gold and food to Zurich. Today, the district is an idyllic place to linger.

places.name: Lake Promenade – The Popular Walking Path at Lake Zurich
places.description: The lakeside park area encloses the lower basin of Lake Zurich with a splendid promenade. Many people gather here to create a colorful scene in summer.

places.name: Langstrasse
places.description: Zurich's former red-light district appeals with its international cuisine, very varied nightlife and urban charm.

places.name: Spiegelgasse – Hot-bed of Revolutionary Art, Literature and Politics
places.description: Europe's artistic and political avant-garde met at the Spiegelgasse at the beginning of the 20th century.

places.name: Thermengasse – Where the Romans Relaxed in Zurich
places.description: Roman baths were discovered by chance during renovation work and consequently much learned about Zurich's history.

places.name: Bürkliplatz – Lakeside Pleasure and Leisure
places.description: Bürkliplatz is not only a boat dock, but also a marketplace, art area and event site with a view across Lake Zurich to the Alps.

places.name: Bahnhofstrasse
places.description: Bahnhofstrasse is Zurich’s renowned shopping boulevard, home to luxury fashion, Swiss watches, fine jewellery, and international brands.

places.name: Augustinergasse
places.description: Augustinergasse is conspicuous for the many bay windows along it. These served not only to provide light, but also had other practical benefits.

places.name: Sheep Piece – Abstract Sheep Graze at the Zürichhorn
places.description: A simple observation inspired Henry Moore to create his “Sheep Piece” work which is based on grazing sheep.

places.name: “L’ange protecteur” by Niki de Saint Phalle
places.description: A gigantic “Nana” in the shape of a guardian angel watches over travelers as they pass through the main concourse at Zurich Main Station.

places.name: “Pavillon-Skulptur” by Max Bill
places.description: The granite sculpture by Max Bill is a key work by the Concrete artist. It stands in the middle of Zurich’s bustling Bahnhofstrasse.

places.name: Stained Glass Windows by Sigmar Polke at the Grossmünster
places.description: Stained-glass windows by Sigmar Polke have adorned the Grossmünster in Zurich since 2009, impressing the many visitors.

places.name: The Gates of Hell by Auguste Rodin
places.description: The famous "Thinker" by Auguste Rodin can also be found in the Gates of Hell outside the Kunsthaus Zurich (art museum).

places.name: “Heureka” by Jean Tinguely
places.description: The first “purposeless machine” by Jean Tinguely stands on the shore of Lake Zurich and still functions perfectly today.

places.name: The Philosopher’s Egg – Mario Merz
places.description: The Philosopher’s Egg by Mario Merz decorates the station concourse at Zurich's Main Railway Station.

places.name: Ritterhaus Bubikon – Visiting the Knights of the Past
places.description: The Ritterhaus in Bubikon is regarded as the best-preserved Commandery of the Order of St. John in Europe. Its roots date back to the 12th century.

places.name: Wasserkirche
places.description: Legend has it that the site of the Wasserkirche church is where Zurich’s patron saints, Felix and Regula, were executed.

places.name: St. Peter – the Oldest Parish Church in Zurich
places.description: The St. Peter church in Zurich has the largest church clock face in Europe. Until 1911, the church tower was used as a fire watch post.

places.name: Reformierte Kirche Horgen – a Rococo-style Trademark
places.description: The Rococo-style Protestant church with 70.5m tower is a landmark of Horgen built by Johann Jakob Haltiner in 1782.

places.name: Liebfrauenkirche – Catholic Church
places.description: Standing slightly higher than Zurich’s Main Train Station, the University Quarter and Central traffic hub, the Liebfrauenkirche church comes into view.

places.name: Fraumünster – art, history and divine stained glass windows
places.description: The Fraumünster and Grossmünster churches are landmarks of Zurich. The convent once held great power in Zurich.

places.name: Dan Rubinstein's Stained Glass Windows
places.description: Stained glass windows by Dan Rubinstein decorate the St. Verena church in Stäfa.

places.name: Augustinerkirche – From House of God to Coin Workshop
places.description: The Augustinerkirche church in Zurich was a coin workshop for 300 years. Today the Münzplatz square reflects the church's temporary use.

places.name: Johann Heinrich Pestalozzi Statue
places.description: Zurich-born Johann Heinrich Pestalozzi was a pioneer of education.

places.name: Monument Huldrych Zwingli – Zurich’s First Reformer
places.description: Zwingli was Zurich’s first reformer. His theology gave rise to the Reformed Church.

places.name: Heinrich Bullinger Sculpture
places.description: The Swiss theologian Heinrich Bullinger reinforced the Reformation in Zurich and beyond.

places.name: Hans Waldmann – a Military Leader and Mayor of Zurich in the Late Middle Ages
places.description: The former mayor Hans Waldmann can be seen by the Münsterbrücke bridge between the Fraumünster and Grossmünster churches.

places.name: Gottfried Keller Statue
places.description: The bust of Gottfried Keller looks out over Lake Zurich from Mythenquai.

places.name: Ganymed – the Prominent Sculpture by Lake Zurich
places.description: The Ganymed sculpture has adorned the Bürkliterrasse since 1952. In mythology, the beautiful young boy of Zeus is abducted and taken to Mount Olympus.

places.name: Rapperswil-Jona Cultural Stations – A Tour of a Shared History
places.description: An open-air museum on the history of the two communities of Rapperswil and Jona

places.name: Alfred Escher Statue
places.description: The Swiss politician and entrepreneur Alfred Escher watches over Zurich's Bahnhofstrasse.

places.name: Waid Vantage Point
places.description: The view from Waid is simply breathtaking. The best times to take the most beautiful souvenir photos are at sunrise and sunset.

places.name: Uetliberg – Zurich’s Very Own Mountain
places.description: The Uetliberg is Zurich’s very own "mountain". From the top, visitors can enjoy beautiful views of the city and lake – and perhaps even a glimpse of the Alps.

places.name: Urania Observatory
places.description: Here Zurich lies at your feet – as the Urania-Sternwarte (observatory) bids exciting views of the cosmos.

places.name: Lindenhof
places.description: From Roman fort to green viewpoint overlooking Zurich: The Lindenhof, an oasis in the heart of the old town, has a fascinating history.

places.name: Felsenegg – Time Out at 2,624-feet Altitude
places.description: Breathtaking views, countless footpaths and an excursion restaurant attract people to the Felsenegg.

places.name: Polyterrasse, Federal Institute of Technology and Zurich University
places.description: The Polyterrasse between the ETH and University offers top views over Zurich's old town

places.name: Bürkliterrasse – Zurich's Front Row Seat by the Lake
places.description: From the Bürkliterrasse in Zurich you enjoy views over Lake Zurich as far as the Alps.

places.name: Stereo Bar
places.description: The beloved meeting place in the heart of Zurich’s Kreis 4, offers carefully curated music, great cocktails, and a vibrant late-night atmosphere.

places.name: Choupette
places.description: This restaurant and bar on Tessinerplatz offers guests a warm and friendly welcome along with excellent cooking.

places.name: Bar Otro
places.description: Cocktails, beer, and bubbles at a bar in the heart of Zurich.

places.name: Cor Wine & Pintxos
places.description: Spanish joy for life meets modern elegance – Cor offers Basque Pintxos and excellent wines.

places.name: Yamas
places.description: Greek hospitality meets Mediterranean flavors.

places.name: Hundertwein
places.description: Exactly 100 low-intervention wines, creative events and a setting, to which every guest wants to come back.

places.name: 169 West
places.description: Natural wines and specialty coffee – 169 West is a delight from morning to night.

places.name: Wine Bar Familiebetrieb
places.description: Excellent wines and cultural events in relaxed atmosphere in the heart of Zurich.

places.name: Gamper Bar
places.description: A beautiful selection of choice natural wines and delicious cocktail snacks.

places.name: Mikkeller Zurich
places.description: A beer lover’s paradise.

places.name: KINOKONI
