places.description: Modern design, an inviting atmosphere, and specially selected cinematic highlights make the KINOKONI a favorite meeting place for movie fans.

places.name: Armando’s by Vergani
places.description: A touch of Italy in the heart of Zurich – awaiting wine lovers on Löwenstrasse in Kreis 1 are indulgence and culture.

places.name: Bierwerk Züri «Tankbierbar»
places.description: Not far from the Main Station, guests at the Tankbierbar drink beer freshly brewed in the bar.

places.name: Gump – Food Outlet at the Oberer Letten
places.description: A dip in the River Limmat or relaxing on the sundeck with friends – this is the place to chill out after work in summer.

places.name: Swiss Life Arena Gastronomy
places.description: Whether for an Italian-style lunch or to get in the mood for the ice hockey game in the Sportsbar.

places.name: Regenbogenhaus Zürich
places.description: The meeting place, cultural venue, and contact point for the LGBTQ+ community, as well as for all those who want to engage and exchange ideas.

places.name: Restaurant Johannisburg
places.description: A fabulous view over Lake Zurich coupled with culinary highlights from the gourmet kitchen: here everything complements each other perfectly.

places.name: Moxy Bar
places.description: As cozy as a living room, but equipped with a professional bar crew, this bar is a real feel-good oasis.

places.name: DUPONT Brasserie & Bar
places.description: Housed in an historical building directly next to Zurich Main Station, the brasserie with bar treats guests to cosmopolitan dishes.

places.name: Zum Frischen Max
places.description: The summer garden, Zum Frischen Max, immediately next to Oerlikon Train Station is a great place to relax after a business meeting or before a concert.

places.name: Igniv Zürich
places.description: Fine dining and sharing concept all in one: that is what is on offer at the top restaurant, Igniv by Andreas Caminada.

places.name: Barchetta Bar & Lounge
places.description: The ideal meeting place for an apéro or a quick lunch directly on the River Limmat.

places.name: Baur’s
places.description: Baur’s brasserie combines international flair with European culinary classics.

places.name: 01 Bar
places.description: Situated on the banks of the River Limmat, the 01 Bar welcomes guests with delicious food and drink from late morning through to late evening.

places.name: The International Beer Bar
places.description: The craft beer enthusiasts in Kreis 5 offer more than just a straightforward Pilsner or two – you’ll also find plenty of hoppy, malt, sour and barrel-aged beers here.

places.name: Rosaly’s Restaurant & Bar
places.description: “Rosaly’s” is a real insider tip for food lovers and is located near Bellevue and the opera house.

places.name: Canvas Bar & Lounge
places.description: High above the city, guests can enjoy classic drinks, elegant design, and out-of-the-ordinary art.

places.name: D-Vino
places.description: Enjoy wine in a relaxed atmosphere and at central locations in the heart of the city.

places.name: Riffraff Bar
places.description: Riffraff is a cultural highlight in the lively Kreis 5 district. Not just because of its movie theater, but also from a gastronomic point of view.

places.name: Cue
places.description: Outstanding barbecued dishes await meat-lovers in the Niederdorf district of Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Park Stadelhofen
places.description: Probably the most central small oasis in Zurich: directly next to Stadelhofen Station, visitors can find a pleasant place to relax.

places.name: Hiltl am See at the Badi Kilchberg
places.description: During the bathing season, both vegetarians and meat lovers are treated to Hiltl creations at the outdoor swimming facility in Kilchberg.

places.name: Minimum
places.description: First a bouldering session, then a healthy meal: the uncomplicated, friendly atmosphere at the Minimum restaurant in Altstetten makes you want to partake in both.

places.name: Upperdeck Restaurant
places.description: The Upperdeck restaurant is located in the middle of the Airport Center at Zurich Airport.

places.name: Belvoir Restaurant & Grill
places.description: At this restaurant, which has been awarded 14 Gault Millau points and features a unique, open charcoal grill, fans of succulent meat and fish dishes are guaranteed to find something to their liking.

places.name: Keen Wellbeing
places.description: Europe’s first “Active Recovery Club” combines regeneration, design, and expertise.

places.name: Bleiche Bad
places.description: A short time-out at this wellness oasis promotes general well-being and long-lasting relaxation.

places.name: Ladies Only Wellness Alma Hotel
places.description: In the heart of Zurich’s Seefeld quarter lies the Alma Hotel, with a wellness area exclusively for women.

places.name: Sauna Boat
places.description: Work up a sweat in the sauna and jump directly into the lake to cool off – an amazing Zurich experience.

places.name: ReFIVE Spa
places.description: Escape everyday life and take some time out to relax: this is possible at the ReFIVE Spa at the FIVE Zurich hotel.

places.name: Die Stadtoase
places.description: This place really lives up to its name: an oasis surrounded by greenery, far away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

places.name: FORTYSEVEN Thermal Wellness Spa
places.description: One of Baden’s absolute highlights is the thermal wellness spa designed by star architect Mario Botta, situated directly on the River Limmat.

places.name: Mercure Zürich City Rooftop-SPA
places.description: At the Mercure Zürich hotel, guests can wind down in the sauna, in the relaxation rooms, or during a massage.

places.name: Zurich Massage and Sport Clinic
places.description: Whether you’ve been exercising, working, or traveling on business, in Kilchberg you will find the right massage for aching muscles.

places.name: Swiss Holiday Park
places.description: Bathing, wellness, sports, go-karting, eating – here there are plenty of things to do, whether on a day trip or on a longer vacation.

places.name: Mineralbad & Spa Rigi Kaltbad
places.description: Relaxation for the body, a treat for the eyes: here you can recharge your batteries and delight in the sensational panorama.

places.name: Rigi in Winter
places.description: Perfect winter days on one of Switzerland’s most beautiful mountains: it is not without reason that the Rigi is known as the “Queen of the Mountains”.

places.name: Kameha Spa and Fitness Power House
places.description: At the ornate Kameha Grand Hotel Zurich, a wellness oasis offers relaxation far away from daily life.

places.name: Hammam Basar + Salon
places.description: Designed according to traditional Maghrebian establishments, the Hammam Basar manifests the love of detail and nature to all the senses.

places.name: AuraVita Health Club & Spa
places.description: Fitness, therapy, beauty, and wellness in the charming City of Roses, Rapperswil.

places.name: Park “Bäckeranlage”
places.description: The “Bäckeranlage” park is one of the most beautiful green areas in the city of Zurich. Situated in the middle of the 4th district, it is a recreational paradise.

places.name: Lakeside Sauna – With Views of Lake Zurich and the City
places.description: Enge swimming area offers recreation at Lake Zurich – including outside of the swimming season – with a sauna.

places.name: Sihlpark Fitness & Wellness – Relaxation and Pampering Program
places.description: A hammam, sauna area, and more besides: here the focus is on pampering and relaxation.

places.name: Stadtbad Zürich – Hammam and Spa in the Volkshaus
places.description: Enjoy the wonderful ritual of a hammam, a massage, and much more besides – here you can switch off and relax in the very heart of the city.

places.name: Labo Spa
places.description: The first day spa in German-speaking Switzerland was voted the best in Switzerland by the Handelszeitung in 2017.

places.name: Hürlimannbad & Spa Zürich
places.description: Bathing Above the Zurich Rooftops.

places.name: Dolder Grand Spa
places.description: Here, guests can relax, dream, and pamper themselves in an outstanding oasis of well-being.

places.name: Belvoir Wellness, Gym & Beauty – Relaxing with a view on Lake Zurich
places.description: In the hotel of the same name on Lake Zurich, guests can relax and unwind or enjoy a soothing massage.

places.name: Alpamare Wellness
places.description: Alpamare is renowned as a water slide paradise. But it also offers all kinds of opportunities for wellness and relaxation.

places.name: Airport Fitness and Wellness
places.description: Work out with gym exercises or relax in the spa: the fitness center at Zurich Airport offers a broad range of wellness and fitness facilities.

places.name: Pizol
places.description: The varied ski area on the Pizol attracts with a wide range of winter activities.

places.name: Flumserberg in Winter
places.description: The winter sports resort not far from Zurich attracts sports enthusiasts with its 65 varied kilometers of slopes.

places.name: Rotenflue-Rätigs Toboggan Run
places.description: A paradise for snow lovers of all ages: the Rotenflue-Rätigs toboggan run is just an hour away from Zurich.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing on the Bachtel
places.description: On the Bachtel in the Zürcher Oberland, several cross-country trails invite winter sports enthusiasts to engage in some sporting activity.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing on the Pfannenstiel
places.description: The longest cross-country ski trail in Canton Zurich extends for an incredible 30 kilometers (19 miles) – albeit providing that there is enough snow.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing in Flumserberg
places.description: In this nearby recreational area – a favorite among Zurich residents ‒ sports lovers can find some 20 km (12.4 miles) of cross-country ski trails set amidst scenery of outstanding beauty.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing in Einsiedeln
places.description: In the Schwedentritt area of in the famous abbey town of Einsiedeln, cross-country skiers can find some 23 kilometers (16 miles) of trails for everyone from beginners to experts.

places.name: High Mountain Trail Zürich-Oberland (Chrüzegg–Rapperswil Section)
places.description: On this leg of the Zurich Oberland high-Alpine trail, hikers can enjoy very varied scenery.

places.name: Hüttchopf
places.description: The Hüttchopf offers the best views of the Töss region and the Alpine world of the Zurich Oberland.

places.name: Industrial Trail
places.description: The Industrial Trail in the Zurich Oberland explores the history of industrialization in the region.

places.name: Wildnisweg Sihlwald
places.address: Hausen am Albis, Post, 8915, Hausen am Albis
places.description: This hike leads through a large, primeval mixed beech forest.

places.name: Sattel-Hochstuckli in Summer
places.description: Just a short drive from Zurich, the pre-Alpine region of Sattel-Hochstuckli offers plenty of variety for nature lovers.

places.name: Experience the Zugerberg in Winter
places.description: Under an hour away from Zurich, anyone seeking relaxation can enjoy downhill and cross-country skiing, tobogganing and winter hiking on the Zugerberg.

places.name: Mt. Titlis in Winter
places.description: The 3,020m (9,908 ft) high Mt.Titlis is one of the most popular excursion and winter sports destinations in Central Switzerland.

places.name: Mt. Pilatus in Winter
places.description: A fantastic panorama, numerous activity options and clean mountain air – it is no wonder that Mt. Pilatus is a popular excursion destination.

places.name: Einsiedeln in Winter
places.description: An enchanting winter world surrounding the famous Einsiedeln Abbey offers a host of activities. You will never get bored in this region.

places.name: Einsiedeln in Summer
places.description: The Einsiedeln region in Canton Schwyz offers enormous variation – with sports, nature, culture and religious places of interest.

places.name: Stoos-Fronalpstock in Winter
places.description: A region in Central Switzerland where the enjoyment of nature and the urge to be active can be ideally combined.

places.name: Mythen in Winter
places.description: The Mythen region offers a great many options for visitors of all ages.

places.name: Chäserrugg in Winter – For Hiking or Skiing
places.description: Hiking, skiing, tobogganing, snowshoe trekking or simply soaking up the sun – everything is possible here.

places.name: Planet Trail – Hike from Uetliberg to Felsenegg
places.description: This easy 2-hour hike on an elevated trail is suitable for the whole family.

places.name: Atzmännig-Chrüzegg Snowshoe Trail
places.description: A trip to the snowy pre-Alp landscapes: With snowshoes hikes through the Atzmännig region.

places.name: Tobogganing above Ricken
places.description: From Alp Egg at an altitude of 1,200 meters (3,937ft), wintertime visitors can toboggan all the way down to Ricken.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing in Ricken
places.description: In the region around Ricken, situated between Lake Zurich and Toggenburg, 24 kilometers (15 miles) of ski trails invite winter sports fans to engage in the classic and skating styles of cross-country skiing.

places.name: Atzmännig in Winter
places.description: Atzmännig is an ideal skiing area for families and beginners.

places.name: Hoch-Ybrig in Winter – Ski & Snowboard Paradise
places.description: Winter sports fans get their fill of enjoyment skiing and snowboarding on the Hoch-Ybrig mountain.

places.name: High Mountain Trail Amden
places.description: On this high-Alpine path high above the Walensee lake, hikers can enjoy some time out accompanied by fantastic panoramic views.

places.name: Skywalk Sattel-Hochstuckli
places.description: At 409 yards, the Skywalk is one of the longest pedestrian suspension bridges in Europe.

places.name: Hoch-Ybrig in Summer – Hiking Paradise
places.description: Mountain fans and nature lovers will find plenty to amuse them with hiking and mountain biking on the Hoch-Ybrig.

places.name: “Sternensauser” Zip Wire
places.description: Adventure-seekers can fly through the air high above the Hoch-Ybrig hiking paradise on the zip wire.

places.name: Batticuore
places.description: The online store offers gravel bikes and suitable accessories for rent and sale – for novice and experienced bikepackers alike.

places.name: PubliBike “Züri Velo”
places.description: Mount the bicycle and set off on a tour of discovery: with “Züri Velo”, sporty urban explorers can ride through the streets of Zurich on two wheels.

places.name: “Züri rollt” – Free Bicycle Rental in Zurich
places.description: “Züri rollt” offers free bicycle rental in the heart of Zurich.

places.name: Hoch-Ybrig Bike School
places.description: The beautiful nature of the Hoch Ybrig recreation area can also be experienced on two wheels.

places.name: Bike Tour from Limmattal Valley to Schwyz
places.description: This bike tour leads in two stages from Zurich’s Limmattal valley into the very heart of primeval Switzerland.

places.name: Bike Tour from the Rhine Falls into the Zurich Oberland
places.description: This cycling route leads from the thundering Rhine Falls via Winterthur into the Zurich Oberland.

places.name: Bike Tour Pilgrimage
places.description: The path leads through sparsely populated, highly scenic, hilly terrain with an abundance of forests.

places.name: Bike Tour Töss – Jona
places.description: From the Tösstal valley, with its meadows, vineyards and witnesses to industrialization in Winterthur, to the beautiful Lake Zurich.

places.name: Bike Tour Glatt Route
places.description: This cycling route from Glattfelden, in the north of Zurich, to Rapperswil follows a path along idyllic riverbanks through Zurich’s suburbs.

places.name: Bike Tour Rhine – Hirzel – Linth
places.description: On this route between Kaiserstuhl and Ziegelbrücke, peaceful valleys and plains alternate with moraine landscapes and lake shores.

places.name: Bike Tour Ibergeregg – Sattelegg – Linth
places.description: Steep and high, not for weak calves and faltering hearts, the Ibergeregg and Sattelegg are a treat for amateur bikers. In between the two, the charming Sihlsee lake is also easy on the eye for those who like to take things more easy.

places.name: Bike Tour from Rapperswil to Baden
places.description: On this route, sporty biking enthusiasts cycle in two stages past grand country mansions on the shore of Lake Zurich to Baden, the spa metropolis of Northern Switzerland.

places.name: Herzroute – by Bicycle Along Lake Zurich
places.description: The Herzroute (Heart Route) is a regional cycle route, leading all the way through Switzerland in a number of stages. One section goes through Canton Zurich.

places.name: Bike Park Allmend – Zurich's BMX and Freestyle Paradise
places.description: BMX fans and freestyle bikers can let off steam on 5 courses at the Bike Park Allmend in Zurich.

places.name: Ziegelei Museum
places.description: Switzerland’s one and only brick and tile museum welcomes visitors in a forest clearing near Cham.

places.name: Umwelt Arena Schweiz
places.description: Tips on sustainability related to modern-day living and answers to questions about energy and the environment – the Umwelt Arena in Spreitenbach is a great place to visit, particularly for families.

places.name: Zurich Succulent Plant Collection
places.description: Plant lovers can find one of the world’s most important collections of succulent plants in Zurich.

places.name: City Gardens
places.description: The City Garden Zurich combines horticultural production with opportunities for education and recreation.

places.name: Beyer Clock and Watch Museum
places.description: The Beyer Clock and Watch Museum is located on Zurich's Bahnhofstrasse in addition to the department stores and shops.

places.name: Moulagenmuseum – Insight Into Zurich's Medical Teaching
places.description: Lifelike images of diseased body parts – a visit to the Moulagenmuseum of the University and University Hospital Zurich is rather different.

places.name: focusTerra – Earth & Science Discovery Center of the ETH Zurich
places.description: The focusTerra museum presents fascinating  special exhibitions on the topic of the Earth and natural sciences.

places.name: Auer & Co
places.description: Mainly known as a coworking space, the Auer is also a popular café that is open to the general public.

places.name: Gelati am See
places.description: A charming mobile ice cream stand at Riesbach harbor, directly on Lake Zurich.

places.name: Dieci Gelateria & Take Away
places.description: Gourmets can find delicious gelati in the heart of the Niederdorf in Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Daizy
places.description: In the heart of the up-and-coming district of Zürich-Binz, the cheerful, colorful culinary oasis, Daizy, enchants locals, tourists, and business people from the nearby offices.

places.name: Kornsilo
places.description: Housed in the former granary of the Tiefenbrunnen Mill, this bistro combines local cuisine, sustainability, and historic charm with a flexible event space.

places.name: Bäckerei Wüst
places.description: In various branches in and around Zurich and Lake Zurich, the Bäckerei Wüst has been cultivating Swiss baking tradition since 1997.

places.name: Gasthof zur Sonne in Stäfa
places.description: At the Gasthof zur Sonne, in the lakeside village of Stäfa, guests can enjoy freshly caught fish, regional wine, and many other culinary delicacies.

places.name: Café Gourmet – Hotel Schweizerhof
places.description: The Café Gourmet, located directly next to the entrance of the Hotel Schweizerhof and opposite Zurich Main Station, is a small but very select bistro.

places.name: Restaurant Langenberg
places.description: At Langenberg Wildlife Park, you can not only observe wild animals at close quarters, but also enjoy great food – directly next to deer and ibex.

places.name: Zum Guten Glück
places.description: Restaurant zum Guten Glück is considered an insider’s tip among young Zürich residents.

places.name: Le Pain Quotidien
places.description: The well-known bakery chain, Le Pain Quotidien, also lures customers to its branch on Römerhof with its freshly baked bread and aromatic coffee.

places.name: Frau Meise
places.description: Café, bar, bistro, guesthouse, cultural site, boutique ... all united in a cozy living room in the heart of the Old Town of Baden.

places.name: Tea&Room Teekult
places.description: The Tea&Room Teekult in the heart of Winterthur sets great store by enabling its guests to enjoy tea in all its variations.

places.name: Confiserie Speck
places.description: The oldest café in Zug is located on the first floor above the Confiserie Speck.

places.name: Bäckerei Jung Schanzengraben
places.description: Exquisite artisan baking meets stylish architecture and a relaxed welcome at this bakery between Paradeplatz and the Schanzengraben canal.

places.name: Wim Bakery
places.description: For all sourdough lovers: In Zurich Wipkingen, the WIM bakery regales its customers with the traditional art of bakery.

places.name: Bro's Beans & Beats
places.description: Aromatic coffee, fresh dishes and good music – a café where enjoyment comes with a soundtrack.

places.name: Collective Bakery
places.description: Artisanal baked goods and home-roasted coffee in Zurich West.

places.name: Draft. Coffee
places.description: Excellent coffee, sparkly drinks and delicious brunch specials in modern atmosphere.

places.name: John Baker Bahnhofstrasse
places.description: A trendy bakery with delicious wares and a clear-cut philosophy.

places.name: KOIVU Café
places.description: At KOIVU, guests can enjoy in a cozy coffee house atmosphere – ideal for switching off and chilling out.

places.name: Kafi Dihei
places.description: “Dihei” means at home. And that's exactly how guests feel in this pretty living room café.

places.name: Lotti
places.description: At Lotti on Werdmühleplatz, those wishing to escape the hustle and bustle of the Bahnhofstrasse can find a cozy, modern ambiance and fresh, seasonal cuisine.

places.name: Café Hintergass
places.description: A small but pleasant restaurant in the heart of the picturesque Old Town of Rapperswil.

places.name: Café & Restaurant Confiserie Sprüngli, Paradeplatz
places.description: Guests meet in one of the city’s most famous café-salons for breakfast, lunch, or coffee and cake, or to enjoy the delectable patisserie.

places.name: Babu’s Bakery & Coffeehouse
places.description: Urban, creative, cozy, and aesthetically pleasing – that is what Babu’s in the bustling heart of Zurich stands for.

places.name: Restaurant Stoller
places.description: Many people know the Restaurant Stoller on Albisriederplatz because of its legendary “Frauentraum” ice cream. But that is not the only thing that makes it worth a visit.

places.name: Café des Amis
places.description: This pleasant café to the northwest of the city center welcomes a diverse mix of guests every day.

places.name: Leafs Restaurant
places.description: Not far from Sihlcity in the verdant oasis of the Leafs Restaurant, you can leave everyday life far behind you and recharge your batteries, thanks to the wonderful flavor combinations of the cuisine and the generous space concept.

places.name: Henrici
places.description: Cozy, urban coffee house with a young, trendy clientele in the heart of the Niederdorf.

places.name: Theater Hora
places.description: The theater with a unique presence and character ‒ thanks to an ensemble consisting entirely of actors with mental disabilities.

places.name: Close Theater
places.description: The name says it all: in Pat Perry’s “magic laboratory”, guests experience magic and mentalism close up.

places.name: Literaturhaus
places.description: In the charming Literaturhaus in Zurich’s Old Town, culture lovers can enjoy literary events in history-steeped surroundings.

places.name: Salon Theater Herzbaracke
places.description: This floating theater is transformed into a truly magical place thanks to its exquisite decor and furnishings and its rare musical instruments.

places.name: Bernhard Theater – a Pleasurable Theater Evening in Zurich
places.description: The only place in Zurich that combines theatrical art with culinary culture in a pleasurable way.

places.name: Maag Halle
places.description: Concerts, shows, parties and events: the Maag Halle offers space for a variety of entertainment.

places.name: Millers
places.description: Millers, a renowned cabaret stage housed in the historic Tiefenbrunnen Mill in Zurich, offers a varied program of satire and music.

places.name: Theater Winterthur
places.description: Switzerland’s largest playhouse for guest performances is based in Winterthur. Europe’s most important ensembles come here to perform.

places.name: Theater Rigiblick
places.description: Zurich’s only theater with a cable car link attracts visitors with a varied program of performances and pleasing ambience at the theater bar.

places.name: Theater Gessnerallee
places.description: Based at a former barracks and only 5 minutes from Zurich Main Railway Station, the Theater Gessneralle offers space for the performing arts.

places.name: Theater Neumarkt
places.description: The Theater Neumarkt at the heart of Zurich’s charming old town reinvents itself every 3 months.

places.name: Theater am Hechtplatz
places.description: There are lots of reasons for laughter at the Theater am Hechtplatz. Come along to Bellevue at the heart of Zurich, where you find the Theater am Hechtplatz close by.

places.name: Theater 11
places.description: Theater 11 is located right alongside the Messe Zurich (exhibition center). You can see some spectacular shows and musicals here.

places.name: Schauspielhaus: Schiffbau
places.description: Ships were once built here at the Schiffbau. Today the industrial building is used for culture and cuisine and contributes to the lively cultural scene in the trendy Zurich-West quarter.

places.name: Schauspielhaus Zürich: Pfauen
places.description: The Schauspielhaus Zürich is one of the most renowned theaters in the German-speaking region.

places.name: Casinotheater Winterthur
places.description: The Casinotheater in Winterthur is a platform for comedy, satire, cabaret, poetry slam, improv theater, and music.

places.name: Zurich Opera House
places.description: The multi award-winning cultural institution on Sechseläutenplatz is one of Zurich’s most famous landmarks.

places.name: Sundays Coffee & Bakery
places.description: Colorful croissants, matcha, and coffee creations: a sweet meeting point in the heart of Zurich West.

places.name: Flavour Coffee & Plants
places.description: Where latte art meets Monstera plants: a wellbeing cafe that combines jungle flair with barista craft.

places.name: Eisladen
places.description: Homemade ice cream with no artificial additives – as it was 100 years ago.

places.name: Bear St. Bakery
places.description: Soft, chunky, and still warm from the oven – it’s easy to see why many people think these are the best American-style cookies in the city.

places.name: Zytlos
places.description: The Café Zytlos is a cozy oasis near Enge Train Station that invites you to stop and linger.

places.name: Conditorei Schober Chocolaterie
places.description: The “Schober” has been a fixture in Zurich since 1874, known for its homemade pâtisserie, pastry and legendary hot chocolate.

places.name: Bäckerei Jung Central
places.description: At this bakery, which catches the eye with its simple interior design, the focus is on a large selection of breads and other delicacies.

places.name: Bakery Bakery
places.description: From vegan bagels to cream slices: here, everyone who has a desire for 100% plant-based baked goods will find what they are looking for.

places.name: The Monocle Shop & Café
places.description: The café run by the magazine, Monocle, exudes an international ambiance in Zurich’s Seefeld quarter.

places.name: Il Baretto
places.description: The cozy bistro on the ground floor of the boutique Hotel St. Josef.

places.name: Coworking Lounge Tessinerplatz
places.description: The perfect combination of a beautiful café and a coworking space can be found at Tessinerplatz.

places.name: Moser’s Backparadies
places.description: In the heart of Baden’s Old Town, with a view of the history-steeped City Tower, Moser’s Backparadies pampers its guests with fresh bread rolls, sandwiches, and desserts.

places.name: Milchbar
places.description: The Milchbar near Paradeplatz also goes under the name of the House of Culinary Pleasure. Here, guests’ taste buds are pampered with professionally brewed coffee, fresh fruit juices, delicatessen products and choice wines.

places.name: Michelle’s Cupcakes
places.description: Michelle delights her guests with homemade cupcakes and other sweet delights.

places.name: Vollenweider Café
places.description: Known for its pralines, cakes, and other confectionery, at the Vollenweider Café in Winterthur guests can also enjoy the sweet delicacies on site.

places.name: Café Zumbach
places.description: In 1851, Jakob Zumbach-Heinrich purchased the bakery on Seestrasse in Unterägeri.

places.name: Gran Café Motta
places.description: Read the newspaper, enjoy Italian coffee culture, and watch passers-by in the heart of Zurich's Old Town.

places.name: Café & Conditorei 1842
places.description: Cakes, cookies, drinking chocolate, and more can be found in this “sweet corner” in Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Café Lindt Home of Chocolate
places.description: Naturally the café at the Lindt Home of Chocolate experience world is abounding in chocolate ‒ but there is much, much more than that.

places.name: Hasta Ice Cream
places.description: The exclusive ice cream creations from Hasta Ice Cream in the Niederdorf quarter delight young and old alike.

places.name: Sorbetto Ice-Cream
places.description: Tradition meets innovation at this small gelateria ‒ and on doing so delights the palates of an entire urban district.

places.name: Mövenpick Ice Cream Gallery
places.description: Every child is familiar with Mövenpick ice creams: the Swiss ice cream artisans have set up shop on Sechseläutenplatz and delight guests all year round with their creations.

places.name: Gelateria di Berna
places.description: Sinfully delicious ice cream made the traditional Italian way can be found at Brupbacherplatz, in Zurich’s Kreis 3 district.

places.name: Cakefriends
places.description: A large selection of cakes can be found at Cakefriends at Zurich’s Main Station.

places.name: Konditorei Confiserie Caredda
places.description: “The store with the wedding cakes in the window” – in Zurich, this sentence is enough for everyone to know what you are talking about.

places.name: Café Felix
places.description: The Café Felix at Bellevue is a popular meeting place for locals and tourists alike.

places.name: Brot Bistro Bar
places.description: The Brot Bistro Bar in the Bäckeranlage offers down-to-earth, market-fresh cuisine all year round. The park lies in the middle of the Langstrasse quarter and is regarded as an urban oasis.

places.name: Swiss Casinos Schaffhausen
places.description: The casino in the center of Schaffhausen offers an ambiance just like in «The Great Gatsby»: luxurious, atmospheric, exciting.

places.name: Coop City Zürich St. Annahof
places.description: The Coop retail company, which is active all over Switzerland, operates a department store in a prestigious location on Bahnhofstrasse in Zurich.

places.name: ShopVille Zurich Main Train Station
places.description: Zurich’s Main Train Station is not just frequented by travelers. It is also home to a shopping mall with numerous stores and restaurants.

places.name: Glatt Shopping Mall
places.description: One of the most popular shopping malls in Switzerland offers an innovative shopping experience with a wide range of boutiques, restaurants and events.

places.name: Airport Shopping at Zurich Airport
places.description: In the public area of Zurich Airport, over 150 stores and restaurants are open daily from early in the morning to late at night.

places.name: Sihlcity Shopping Center
places.description: Leisure activities, shopping, and entertainment in the former Zurich paper mill on the River Sihl.

places.name: Heiliger Bimbam! – Christmas Market
places.description: A creative Christmas market where art, design, and sustainable gift ideas come together in an urban setting.

places.name: Winterthur Winter Market
places.description: This winter wonderland in the picturesque city of Winterthur offers magical moments, a myriad of colorful lights, and delicious food.

places.name: Zürcher Weihnachtsallee
places.description: A place full of indulgence, discoveries, and encounters in Europaallee, directly next to Zurich Main Station.

places.name: Münsterhof Christmas Market
places.description: Under the motto “From Zurich for Zurich”, here visitors can find high- quality, local products from the surrounding stores and boutiques.

places.name: City Christmas Market
places.description: The City Christmas Market, situated between the Jelmoli and Globus department stores, invites visitors to browse and enjoy.

places.name: Zurich’s “Wienachtsdorf” at Sechseläutenplatz
places.description: One of the largest Christmas markets in the city of Zurich is held at Sechseläutenplatz, directly in front of the Opera House.

places.name: Einsiedeln Christmas Market
places.description: The Einsiedeln Christmas market in front of Einsiedeln Abbey is particularly impressive.

places.name: Christmas Market in Winterthur
places.description: The fragrant aromas of cinnamon and mulled wine put Winterthur in a Christmassy mood each year.

places.name: "Christkindlimärt" in Rapperswil-Jona
places.description: The Christmas market in Rapperswil-Jona is a very special gem. Its picturesque backdrop includes the medieval Old Town and Rapperswil Castle.

places.name: Christmas Market Dörfli in the Niederdorf
places.description: Zurich's oldest Christmas market is held every year in the Niederdorf quarter.

places.name: The Singing Christmas Tree and Christmas Market
places.description: This Christmas market enchants with its unique daily concerts.

places.name: Polarzauber at Zurich Main Station
places.description: The city’s most central Christmas market: Zurich’s main station transforms into a huge indoor winter wonderland during Advent.

places.name: FIVE Zurich Nightclub
places.description: After darkness has fallen, the rooftop restaurant with bar and lounge at the FIVE Hotel is transformed into a nightclub with live DJs.

places.name: Theatersaal Volkshaus Zürich
places.description: Directly on Helvetiaplatz, music lovers, culture enthusiasts, and partygoers can enjoy unforgettable moments in Zurich.

places.name: Micas Garten
places.description: Micas Garten

places.name: Geerlisburg
places.description: The Geerlisburg restaurant near Kloten treats guests to a beautiful terrace surrounded by greenery, as well as locally sourced produce.

places.name: Restaurant Babel
places.description: The restaurant at the Hyatt Regency Zurich Airport The Circle treats guests to flavors from the Middle East.

places.name: Jardin Zürichberg
places.description: The scents of lavender and the Provence waft through the air on this terrace, with its far-reaching view over Lake Zurich.

places.name: Brustenegg Hütte
places.description: Situated near to the Rope Adventure Park at the Atzmännig leisure resort, the Brustenegg mountain hut with its large sun terrace invites visitors to lean back and chill out.

places.name: Eventlocation Visitor Center
places.description: Der Seminarraum an bester Lage in Rapperswil-Jona mit grosser Terrasse, gemütlicher Lounge und Blick auf den Zürichsee.

places.name: Sihlhölzli Sports Center
places.description: Center for sports and exercise in Zurich.

places.name: 10 km Jogging Route in Zurich
places.description: Joggers can breathe in clean, fresh forest air on this fabulous woodland jogging trail high above the city.

places.name: 7 km Jogging Route in Zurich
places.description: This running route leads through the former industrial district, now Zurich’s trendy quarter.

places.name: 4 km Jogging Route in Zurich
places.description: This urban nature running route leads along the lake basin and past many of Zurich’s tourist attractions.

places.name: Green Marathon Zurich
places.description: The Zurich marathon for all running enthusiasts – without time pressure and with stunningly beautiful trail sections.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing in Bolzberg-Trachslau
places.description: The three cross-country ski trails in picturesque surroundings are suitable for proficient skiers, as well as for beginners and children.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing in Studen/Unteriberg
places.description: This circular track set in the majestic Schwyz mountain landscape demands stamina and technique.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing in Rothenthurm
places.description: The varied Finnenloipe in the Nordic-looking high valley offers a unique opportunity to enjoy the joys of nature.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing in Stoos
places.description: Cross-country skiing in the small, car-free resort of Stoos at 1,300 meters (4,265ft) above sea level promises an unforgettable experience amidst an enchanting winter landscape.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing on the Zugerberg
places.description: Cross-country ski enthusiasts who like a bit of a challenge can find some undulating trails on Zug’s home mountain, the Zugerberg. And the view of the spectacular Alpine panorama is an additional plus.

places.name: Braunwald Country  – Ski and Winter Paradise
places.description: The car-free Braunwald resort lies at 1,256 meters (4,121 ft.) above sea level and is an ideal starting point to discover the snowy mountain world.

places.name: Cross-Country Skiing in Amden
places.description: High above the small village of Amden, winter sports fans can enjoy cross-country skiing on 7 kilometers (4 miles) of trails.

places.name: Grazie Zurigo
places.description: Pizza by the slice, antipasti, and a winter Pasta Club: anyone who loves Italian food and culture will feel at home at Grazie Zurigo.

places.name: Restaurant Kantine
places.description: Seasonal lunch specials and for dinner Pasta Tavolata in Zurich’s trendy neighborhood.

places.name: Restaurant Sonnenberg
places.description: High above Zurich, classic Swiss dishes meet elegant gourmet cooking with a breathtaking view.

places.name: Zafferano
places.description: This Italian restaurant celebrates the motto “Good things come from simplicity”

places.name: All about crêpe
places.description: Sweet or savory crêpes inspired by French tradition – perfect to enjoy on the move.

places.name: Bodega Española
places.description: Cult in Zurich: the oldest Spanish wine store in Zurich with its own restaurant was founded in 1874.

places.name: LOI Bistro
places.description: Contemporary and inspiring culinary dishes served amidst the ancient brewery walls on the Löwenbräukunst-Areal.

places.name: Milchmanufaktur Einsiedeln
places.description: The Milchmanufaktur – or milk manufactory – transforms first-rate Swiss Alpine milk into top-quality products. In the restaurant, traditional dishes made using regional ingredients are served.

places.name: Rütihof Winery
places.description: At the Rütihof winery, the vines are cultivated according to the highest standards of natural viticulture.

places.name: Frisk Fisk
places.description: Straight from Norway onto the plates in Zurich: the finest Norwegian salmon takes centre stage at Frisk Fisk.

places.name: Cartell
places.description: Anyone who would like to experience a little bit of Mexico in Zurich should head for the Cartell.

places.name: Restaurant Engel
places.description: The Restaurant Engel in the hotel of the same name impresses with its seasonally adapted dishes.

places.name: Fischerstube Zürihorn
places.description: The legendary restaurant is clearly visible from the lake.

places.name: Hotel Restaurant Schiff
places.description: Guests are attracted to the Schiff by its fresh fish directly from Lake Zurich and the most beautiful sunsets.

places.name: Hafenbeiz Mönchhof am See
places.description: Anyone who likes simple but cozy locales will love the Hafenbeiz Mönchhof am See in Kilchberg.

places.name: Kümin Weinbau
places.description: Now in the fourth generation, the Kümin family in Freienbach on Lake Zurich devotes themselves to growing and selling wine.

places.name: Bachmann Winery
places.description: The winery with a breathtaking view over Lake Zurich.

places.name: Parea
places.description: A visit to the Restaurant Parea in Zurich is just like taking a short trip to Greece.

places.name: Gasthaus Albisgütli
places.description: At Gasthaus Albisgütli, guests can enjoy traditional Swiss cuisine, a wonderful view of the city, and a piece of Zurich’s history.

places.name: Schwarzenbach Weinbau
places.description: The Schwarzenbach family has been producing wine on the shores of Lake Zurich for five generations.

places.name: Weingut Irsslinger
places.description: The winery’s vision is clear: to produce exciting wines that have a story to tell.

places.name: Le Relais de l’Entrecôte
places.description: Long since legendary in Paris, the French restaurant is now also conquering the taste buds of meat lovers in Zurich.

places.name: Restaurant Olea
places.description: The Mediterranean restaurant, Olea, at the Hotel Seedamm Plaza promises cuisine that tantalizes the taste buds.

places.name: Weisses Rössli
places.description: At this elegantly refurbished restaurant, guests enjoy wonderfully light cuisine inspired by French-Mediterranean cuisine.

places.name: Rosso Arancio
places.description: The Rosso Arancio at Stauffacher is (still) an insider tip for true gelati lovers.

places.name: Inselwirtschaft Ufnau
places.description: An island in the middle of Lake Zurich. And on it, a wonderfully cozy restaurant under shady plane trees.

places.name: Sternen Grill Oben
places.description: At the Sternen Grill Oben, guests can enjoy other Swiss specialties in addition to the legendary Sternen grilled sausages.

places.name: Landgasthof Krone, Sihlbrugg
places.description: A culinary treat on your plate coupled with an attentive service. The Krone is the epitome of hospitality and excellent taste.

places.name: Weinstube 1923
places.description: Hungry people can find a little insider tip directly at Central, close to Zurich Main Station.

places.name: Weisser Wind – Guild House and Restaurant
places.description: Located in the heart of Zurich’s Oberdorf quarter, the Weisser Wind restaurant unites a restaurant, guild house, and cultural stage under one roof.

places.name: Tillsamman
places.description: The modern Swedish restaurant with a deli store for fans of Scandinavian cuisine.

places.name: Winery of Einsiedeln Abbey
places.description: Superior wines from the largest island in Switzerland.

places.name: Diederik Winery
places.description: On Zurich’s “Gold Coast”, two young vintners have breathed new life into a tradition-steeped winery.

places.name: Juchhof Municipal Farm
places.description: In the Höngg quarter, the farm run by the City of Zurich has its own vineyard, in which it grows grapes for the city wine.

places.name: Zweifel Winery
places.description: The family firm, which can trace its roots as far back as the 14th century, produces spectacular wines from its own vineyards in the city, the Limmat Valley, and the “Gold Coast” region along Lake Zurich.

places.name: Landolt Winery
places.description: The Landolt family has specialized in viticulture over six generations and cultivates some of the most beautiful vineyards in the city.

places.name: Seerestaurant L’O
places.description: The wonderful lakeside restaurant simply oozes Mediterranean charm.

places.name: Schiffstation (Männedorf)
places.description: A very special restaurant has established itself directly next to the boat landing stage in Männedorf: the Schiffstation.

places.name: Die Rose
places.description: Here, in a 400-year-old half-timbered house on Lake Zurich, the chef conjures exquisite cuisine onto guests’ plates.

places.name: Gasthof Sternen, Badstube
places.description: Just outside the city, gourmets can indulge themselves at the historic Gasthof Sternen in Wangen, near Dübendorf.

places.name: Sihlhalde Gattikon
places.description: In Gattikon Zürich, Gregor Smolinsky aka “Smoly” amazes with his culinary classics and new discoveries. It is not without reason that he was voted GaultMillau’s “Chef of the Month”.

places.name: Rico’s
places.description: The host from whom Rico’s takes its name has breathed new life into Rico's in Küsnacht, with much love, color, and imagination.

places.name: Restaurant Buech, Herrliberg
places.description: The Restaurant Buech serves excellent food overlooking the lake and surrounded by an old vineyard.

places.name: Höcklistein Winery
places.description: A historical vineyard at the upper end of Lake Zurich, with a magnificent view of the lake and the Town of Roses, Rapperswil.

places.name: Più Schiffbau
places.description: “Love without kisses is like pizza without cheese”: the Più restaurant celebrates the love of pizza.

places.name: Outback Lodge
places.description: A culinary trip to Australia with a typical down under feeling: laid-back, always sunny, and with a hint of adventure.

places.name: Brasserie zum Vorbahnhof
places.description: Lovers of Swiss cuisine can find this rustic restaurant serving traditional dishes directly opposite Zurich Main Train Station.

places.name: Filini
places.description: Perfect for a real Italian business lunch: Filini treats guests to mouthwatering cuisine.

places.name: Baracca Zermatt
places.description: Baracca Zermatt near Zurich Airport is the place to go for delicious cheese fondue in authentic mountain-chalet style.

places.name: Marco’s Pasta Bar
places.description: The name says it all: pasta lovers need look no further, as the restaurant owner holds several world records in sauce-making.

places.name: Raclette Factory
places.description: The name says it all: the Raclette Factory on Rindermarkt, in the heart of Zurich’s Old Town, is a popular address for all cheese lovers and those who want to try this typical Swiss specialty.

places.name: Restaurant Alter Tobelhof
places.description: The restaurant Alter Tobelhof is a historically protected farm situated on Zurich’s city boundary. Correspondingly, guests are treated to Swiss culinary delights.

places.name: Fondue Gondolas by SwissAlpeChuchi
places.description: Five cozy-looking gondolas in front of the Walliser Keller restaurant evoke a real mountain feeling in the heart of Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Restaurant Limmathof
places.description: Creative cuisine in the close vicinity of the Viadukt: the Limmathof is a popular restaurant for locals and tourists alike, both at lunchtime and in the evening.

places.name: Da Angela
places.description: Just around the corner from Letzipark: pasta, fish, and meat – served just as it would be in Italy.

places.name: Restaurant Schloss Laufen
places.description: Schloss Laufen towers on a rock overlooking the largest waterfall in Europe. In addition to an abundance of history and a breathtaking view, it is also home to Schloss Laufen restaurant.

places.name: Schönau Bar & Restaurant
places.description: Summer vacation all year round: this is what guests experience at the Schönau Bar & Restaurant directly next to the Bäckeranlage municipal park.

places.name: Conrad
places.description: In the heart of the city, just a few meters from the Bahnhofstrasse, guests at the Restaurant Conrad enjoy cutting-edge gastronomy coupled with tradition and Swissness.

places.name: Hiltl Sihlpost
places.description: Vegetarian and vegan culinary delights served in the main hall of a former post office, directly next to Zurich Main Station.

places.name: Keywest Seerestaurant
places.description: The Keywest is located in Oberrieden, directly on the lake – the view, the private jetty, and the excellent cuisine are always worth an excursion.

places.name: The Artisan
places.description: The popular district of Zürich Wipkingen is home to The Artisan, a lively neighborhood restaurant and green oasis in the heart of the city.

places.name: PUCI'S Stauffacher
places.description: This Italian restaurant offers freshly prepared, unpretentious dishes as well as a takeout option, all at attractive prices.

places.name: Don Weber
places.description: Zurich’s first Mexican restaurant: the locals have been coming to the Don Weber for burritos, quesadillas, and other Mexican specialties since 1989.

places.name: Brasserie Spirgarten
places.description: Hotel guests and locals alike meet here for a “neighborhood beer” and enjoy Swiss food.

places.name: Amalfi
places.description: Gourmets embark on a culinary journey to southern Italy at the Amalfi, in Zurich’s Seefeld quarter.

places.name: Santa Lucia Paradeplatz
places.description: Time stands still for a moment or two at the Santa Lucia Paradeplatz, in the heart of Zurich’s business district.

places.name: Conti
places.description: The elegant restaurant next to Zurich Opera House exudes pure passion for gastronomy – and especially for outstanding Italian cuisine.

places.name: Bindella
places.description: The Ristorante Bindella near Bahnhofstrasse serves Venetian specialties in elegant surroundings.

places.name: Vallocaia
places.description: The Tuscan restaurant, “Vallocaia”, is situated on Hirschenplatz, in Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Trattoria Sempre
places.description: A little piece of Italy in the heart of Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Più Europaallee
places.description: Italy fans can find a hint of Naples in the lovingly converted, 7m (23ft) high hall of the former Sihlpost post office, near to Zurich Main Train Station.

places.name: Santa Lucia Niederdorf
places.description: In a unique ambiance in Zurich’s Niederdorf quarter, students, tourists and locals sit down at the table to enjoy crispy pizzas and other Italian specialties.

places.name: Santa Lucia Corso
places.description: Sometimes it simply has to be a pizza ‒and the Santa Lucia Corso is the ideal place to go. The high-ceilinged rooms in the history-steeped building near Bellevue give a feeling of cosmopolitan vastness.

places.name: Spaghetti Factory Rosenhof
places.description: The Spaghetti Factory is located on the romantic Rosenhof square, in the heart of Zurich’s Niederdorf quarter.

places.name: Fondue Chalet Zürichberg
places.description: On cold winter evenings, there is nothing better than a convivial fondue with friends. The Fondue Chalet on the Zürichberg offers the perfect setting.

places.name: Bergrestaurant Alp Egg
places.description: At the Bergrestaurant Alp Egg, nature lovers will find peace and quiet, relaxation and delicious food, and are treated to beautiful views of Lake Zurich.

places.name: Wirtsstube Münsterhöfli
places.description: At the Münsterhöfli, situated directly on Münsterhof, hungry guests can choose between wholesome fare and elegant dishes.

places.name: Restaurant Markthalle
places.description: As is typical for a market restaurant, the Markthalle Restaurant serves hot food made with fresh, regional, and seasonal ingredients.

places.name: Walliser Kanne
places.description: At the Walliser Kanne, situated in the heart of the city of Zurich, guests can immerse themselves in the Valais mountain world.

places.name: Santo
places.description: The Santo restaurant welcomes its guests in the heart of Zurich’s charming Wiedikon quarter and treats them to mouthwatering Italian delicacies.

places.name: Equi-Table
places.description: At Zurich’s Equi-Table, sustainable products are transformed into gastronomic delights thanks to its innovative style of cuisine.

places.name: Palestine Grill
places.description: The snack bar in the middle of Langstrasse attracts hungry customers with specialties from Palestine and booming hip-hop and reggae sounds.

places.name: La Bottega di Mario
places.description: Whether a Ticino appetizer platter, a succulent brasato, or homemade ravioli – the Bottega di Mario brings Ticino sunshine to Zurich.

places.name: Pizzeria Ristorante Molino Select
places.description: The place where avant-garde movies once flickered across the screen is now home to the Pizzeria Ristorante Molino Select.

places.name: Ristorante Frascati
places.description: Situated on the lakeside promenade in Zurich’s Seefeld quarter, the Frascati embodies the Italian way of life, which is also reflected in its food.

places.name: L’Unico
places.description: At the restaurant, L’Unico, housed in the Hotel Kameha Grand Zürich in the north of the city, guests enjoy the finest Italian cuisine.

places.name: Casa Ferlin
places.description: For over a century, the Ferlin family has been treating its guests in Zurich to delicious home-made ravioli and other traditional Italian specialties.

places.name: Marktküche
places.description: Popular not just among vegans: the Marktküche in Zurich’s Kreis 4 quarter offers all connoisseurs appetizing dishes that leave nothing to be desired.

places.name: Fondue-Tram
places.description: Dip your fondue fork into the melted cheese while the new event-tram trundles through Zurich on its circular tour.

places.name: Runway 34
places.description: The flight experience restaurant is located in Glattbrugg, between the city of Zurich and Zurich International Airport.

places.name: TimeOut
places.description: The TimeOut restaurant, which belongs to the Hotel St. Josef, lies above Bellevue and near to the Kunsthaus and Schauspielhaus.

places.name: RIBELLI Zürich
places.description: Neapolitan pizzas and an in-house salumeria can be found at the 25hours Hotel Zürich West.

places.name: Hiltl Pflanzbar
places.description: The Pflanzbar provides vegetarian specialties and an out-of-the-ordinary ambiance in one of Zurich's most beautiful flower shops.

places.name: Restaurant Bärengasse
places.description: The Restaurant Bärengasse is located in the heart of Zurich in the colonnaded atrium of Credit Suisse on Paradeplatz.

places.name: Restaurant Uto Kulm
places.description: Here “Top of Zurich” is not simply an advertising slogan, it is reality: the Restaurant Uto Kulm restaurant is situated on the top of the Uetliberg, with a view of the city, Lake Zurich and the Alps.

places.name: PUCI'S Oerlikon
places.description: Quick, down to earth, and delicious: delicious pasta dishes to enjoy in-house or to go await near  Sternen Oerlikon.

places.name: The Restaurant – Dolder Grand
places.description: The gourmet restaurant at the Dolder Grand is simply called “The Restaurant” ‒ straightforward and frill-free, just like the star-studded cuisine served here.

places.name: Ziegel oh Lac
places.description: The Ziegel oh Lac, which belongs to the Rote Fabrik, lies directly on the lakeshore with a view of the city – and sometimes even of the Alps.

places.name: Alpenrose
places.description: The Alpenrose lies in the vibrant Kreis 5 district. Both visually and gastronomically, it is a journey back in time to the Switzerland of yesteryear.

places.name: Cheese Fondue Cruise
places.description: On the Cheese Fondue Cruise, guests can tuck into the Swiss national dish during a leisurely boat trip on Lake Zurich.

places.name: Bederhof
places.description: This neighborhood restaurant offers home-style cooking at reasonable prices. Everything is freshly prepared and wherever possible regionally sourced.

places.name: Restaurant Gaststube – Boutiquehotel Sonne
places.description: Cozy, charming, and right by Lake Zurich: Restaurant Gaststube delights with outstanding cooking and an authentic atmosphere.

places.name: Restaurant Helvetia
places.description: A hundred paces from Stauffacher is the Restaurant Helvetia – the central meeting place for a convivial atmosphere, gourmet yet down-to-earth cuisine, and friendly service.

places.name: Hotel Restaurant Frohe Aussicht Uznach
places.description: The name say it all: the Frohe Aussicht (lit. happy view) in Uznach offers an unrivalled view and a cozy, down-to-earth ambiance.

places.name: Bergrestaurant Atzmännig Harz
places.description: This cozy mountain restaurant is just five minutes’ walk from the summit station of the Atzmännig chairlift.

places.name: PUR Rössli Lounge
places.description: Situated on the upper part of Lake Zurich, this restaurant offers stunning views of the lake and spaces for very special events.

places.name: Restaurant Schützenhaus
places.description: Situated directly at the harbor in Stäfa, the Restaurant Schützenhaus treats guests to fresh fish specialties.

places.name: Swiss Chuchi – Hotel Adler
places.description: Central, hearty, Swiss – the Swiss Chuchi in the Hotel Adler is located near Limmatquai, in the heart of the city of Zurich.

places.name: Atzmännig Valley Station
places.description: The Atzmännig Lodge restaurant is located at the valley station of the small but select Atzmännig summer and winter sports resort.

places.name: Taverne – Hotel Hirschen
places.description: The Gasthof Hirschen is situated in the municipality of Meilen, directly on the shores of the beautiful Lake Zurich.

places.name: Altschwand
places.description: The Altschwand Alpine Restaurant is located near the Atzmännig.

places.name: Bindella Vinoteca
places.description: Those who are looking for the perfect Italian wine should try their luck at the Vinoteca Bindella.

places.name: The Flave of Zurich
places.description: Located in Hotel Novotel in the vibrant Zurich West quarter, this restaurant combines mediterranean flavors with local ingredients.

places.name: Restaurant Jakob Rapperswil
places.description: This restaurant in the heart of Rapperswil’s Old Town attracts guests with the freshest of ingredients.

places.name: Blindekuh
places.description: It is said that you also eat with your eyes – so what is it like if you cannot see what you are eating? At the Blindekuh restaurant, which is completely in the dark, all your senses focus on the taste.

places.name: Bianchi
places.description: Fish specialties are served at the Bianchi on Limmatquai.

places.name: Altes Klösterli
places.description: The restaurant next to Zurich Zoo serves modern Swiss classics in a welcoming atmosphere.

places.name: Restaurant Adlisberg
places.description: A great place to relax is the Adlisberg restaurant, which lies just outside the city of Zurich surrounded by beautiful scenery.

places.name: Zurich James Joyce Foundation
places.description: A unique place for all friends of literature: The James Joyce Foundation was established with a view to keeping alive the heritage of the famous Irish writer.

places.name: KMM Kulturzentrum
places.description: Music history that delights: at this museum, everything revolves around mechanical musical instruments.

places.name: The Zurich Galleries (Association)
places.address: c/o Galerie & Edition Marlene Frei, 8004, Zürich
places.description: The association represents over 40 of the most renowned galleries in the city of Zurich dealing in contemporary art.

places.name: Galerie Peter Kilchmann
places.description: Peter Kilchmann has decisively shaped the Zurich art scene with his motto, “Art must be politically relevant.”

places.name: Galerie Hauser & Wirth
places.description: The influential couple from the international art scene run a gallery on the site of the former Löwenbräu brewery.

places.name: Galerie Gmurzynska
places.description: The Galerie Gmurzynska, founded by Antonina Gmurzynska in 1965 in Cologne, Germany, is one of the most important art galleries worldwide specializing in classic modern art and Russian avant-garde.

places.name: Galerie Eva Presenhuber
places.description: The influential pioneer of the Zurich art scene runs a gallery directly next to the Prime Tower in Zürich-West.

places.name: Photobastei
places.description: In the photographic heart of the city, visitors can actively immerse themselves in the theme of photography.

places.name: Zurich Architecture Center ZAZ Bellerive
places.description: The Zurich architecture center, ZAZ Bellerive, invites members of the public to immerse themselves in the themes of urbanism, space, architecture and the environment – and also to put forward their own viewpoints.

places.name: Kino Pathé Dietlikon
places.description: In the Pathé, situated on the outskirts of the city of Zurich, film enthusiasts can find one of the largest movie theater complexes in Switzerland.

places.name: blue Cinemas
places.description: Four of the most popular cinemas in Zurich are among Switzerland's largest cinema operators - blue Cinemas.

places.name: Filmpodium
places.description: The Filmpodium is one of the most attractive movie theaters in the city.

places.name: Arena Cinemas Sihlcity
places.description: Movie fans who would like to watch their favorite blockbusters with state-of-the-art technology should be sure to visit the Arena Cinemas at the Sihlcity leisure center.

places.name: Kino Xenix
places.description: Fans of independent movies should head for the Kino Xenix, in the heart of the Langstrasse quarter.

places.name: Museum für Gestaltung – Ausstellungsstrasse
places.description: The main building of the museum for design is just a few minutes’ walk from Zurich Main Station.

places.name: Swiss Finance Museum
places.description: Anyone who would like to find out how our economic system works or how stock exchange trading originated should be sure to pay a visit to the Swiss Finance Museum in the Zürich-West quarter.

places.name: Chocolarium – The Happiness Factory of Munz and Minor
places.description: In the Maestrani world of discovery, visitors learn how happiness gets into chocolate.

places.name: Forum of Swiss History
places.description: Swiss history and traditions, vividly explained in a prime location in Schwyz.

places.name: Johann Caspar Lavater Collection
places.description: The Zurich-born pastor and author was an important figure in the 18th century. Here, interested persons can find out more about his life.

places.name: Museum of the Swiss Charters of Confederation
places.description: This museum houses an impressive collection of original documents and information exploring the history of the Old Swiss Confederacy.

places.name: Fondazione Sasso San Gottardo
places.description: People of all ages will be fascinated by this former military fortress – there is so much to see.

places.name: Houdini Kino/Cinema
places.description: This movie theater not only enriches the city’s cultural facilities, but is also visually well worth a visit.

places.name: Riffraff Kino/Cinema
places.description: Movies in their original versions, insider tips and comfortable seats – no wonder this movie theater enjoys cult status.

places.name: Zurich Chamber Orchestra (ZKO)
places.description: The Zurich Chamber Orchestra is an ensemble that enjoys an excellent reputation worldwide.

places.name: Museum of Pre-History
places.description: 20,000 years of fascinating history under one roof: at the Museum of Pre-History, people interested in bygone times can travel back into the past.

places.name: Thomas Mann Archive at the ETH Zurich
places.description: The manuscripts, letters, and diaries at the Thomas Mann Archive at the ETH Zurich offer an insight into the poet’s literary creations.

places.name: Strauhof (Literature Museum)
places.description: Here literature can be experienced in all its many facets: this place for lovers of good books, bibliophiles, graphic art enthusiasts, and wordsmiths lies in the heart of the Old Town.

places.name: Stadthaus – Exhibitions in the House of the People of Zurich
places.description: The Stadthaus Zurich (town hall) is located on the left banks of the River Limmat, right alongside the Fraumünster church. Temporary exhibitions are held under the archways.

places.name: Haus zur Farb in Stäfa – 500 Years of Local History
places.description: The Haus zur Farb is based in Stäfa and is one of the oldest buildings in the town. Today it is a museum and exhibits items from the past 500 years.

places.name: Museum of Civil Defense  – a Place of History
places.description: The Museum of Civil Defense is located beneath a park in Zurich in a bunker dating from 1941. It tells the story of civil defense in Switzerland.

places.name: Zunftstadt Zurich
places.description: A turbulent journey back through 700 years of Zurich's guild history in the former “Zum blauen Himmel” building at the heart of the old town.

places.name: Wine Growing Museum on Lake Zurich
places.description: The Wine Growing Museum is well worth a visit for wine enthusiasts. The idyllic location on the Au peninsula makes this a particularly charming visit.

places.name: Ethnographic Museum at the University of Zurich
places.description: The social anthropology science museum stands in a beautiful location in the heart of the city in the Old Botanical Garden.

places.name: Stadtmuseum Rapperswil-Jona – a Journey Back in Time
places.description: The Stadtmuseum Rapperswil-Jona (city museum) covers 800 years of history – from mediaeval pilgrims to a popular tourist destination by Lake Zurich.

places.name: Zentralbibliothek Zurich – Archive of the Centuries
places.description: Zurich's history is brought to life here: temporary exhibitions feature treasures from 15 centuries.

places.name: Tonhalle-Orchester Zürich
places.description: Zürich’s Tonhalle-Orchester has been delighting fans of classical music since 1868.

places.name: Arthouse Cinemas Zurich
places.description: Arthouse Cinemas Zurich show independent films from all over the world. Original versions of current film festival highlights hit the screen here.

places.name: NONAM – North America Native Museum Zurich
places.description: An atmospheric exhibition dedicated to the native people of North America in Zurich’s Seefeld district.

places.name: Museum für Gestaltung on the Toni-Areal
places.description: The Museum für Gestaltung has a second location on the Toni-Areal, which is the campus of the Zurich University of the Arts.

places.name: MoneyMuseum
places.description: How does money influence our lives today? How has it changed? The MoneyMuseum inspires visitors to ponder on the subject of money and its significance.

places.name: History Museum Baden
places.description: The history of Baden is brought to life at the Landvogteischloss (governor’s castle).

places.name: Swiss Heritage Center at the Villa Patumbah
places.description: The Heritage Center is housed in a beautiful villa at a spot in Zurich.

places.name: Haus zum Rech – Construction History and City Archive
places.description: The Haus zum Rech has been part of Zurich’s old town for 800 years. Today it houses the city archives

places.name: gta Exhibitions – ETH Zurich
places.description: Temporary exhibitions on architectural themes are held at the ETH Zurich on the Hönggerberg.

places.name: Fotostiftung Schweiz – Switzerland's Photography Center
places.description: Fotostiftung Schweiz is dedicated to photography both past and present and a comprehensive collection together with an archive and library can be viewed in Winterthur.

places.name: Fotomuseum Winterthur – Museum of Photography and Photographic Media
places.description: The Swiss Museum of Contemporary and Classic Arts and Documentary Photography enjoys international acclaim for its exhibitions.

places.name: Museum of FC Zurich
places.description: The FCZ-Museum tells the story of Zurich’s football club since its founding in the year 1896.

places.name: Enea Tree Museum – Botany and Architecture Over 75,000 m2
places.description: The Enea Tree Museum is located in an impressive park close to Lake Zurich. It combines landscape, botany, architecture, art and design in a single park.

places.name: Architekturforum Zurich – Information on Contemporary Architecture
places.description: Anyone interested in urban planning and contemporary architecture is advised to head for the Architekturforum Zurich.

places.name: Archaeological Collection of the University of Zurich
places.description: The Archaeological Institute at the University of Zurich is home to one of Switzerland's most important collections of antique art.

places.name: Alterthümer-Magazin – a Journey Through Zurich's Ancient Style of Living
places.description: A furnishing store with a difference –  and place to marvel at curiosities inside the Alterthümer-Magazin, home to a historic and memorable Zurich collection.

places.name: Globus, Bahnhofstrasse
places.description: The renowned department store, Globus, has established itself as an integral part of Zurich shopping mile. Inside everything revolves around savoir vivre, style and indulgence.

places.name: Globus Bellevue
places.description: A world full of indulgence with delicatessen products and international specialties.

places.name: Bongénie
places.description: The fashion store on Paradeplatz has been delighting shoppers for more than a century.

places.name: Einsiedeln Ice Park
places.description: Ice skaters and Bavarian curling fans can engage in their sports in the abbey town of Einsiedeln.

places.name: Heuried Sports Center
places.description: At the Heuried sports center, located between Zurich Main Station and the foot of the Uetliberg, sports enthusiasts can find an open-air bathing facility and – in winter – an outdoor ice rink.

places.name: Lachen Ice Rink by Lake Zurich
places.description: The outdoor ice rink in Lachen, situated directly next to Lake Zurich, offers fun for all the family.

places.name: Farfar Ice Camp Wollerau
places.description: Here ice hockey and ice skating fans live out their passion not only in winter, but all year round.

places.name: Ice Skating at the Dolder Open-Air Ice Rink
places.description: Built in 1930, the Dolder open-air ice rink is one of the largest of its kind in Europe and enthralls ice-skating enthusiasts from both home and abroad.

places.name: Ice Skating in Rapperswil
places.description: Directly by the lido in Rapperswil you find an ice-skating hall and outdoor facility.

places.name: Letzigrund Stadium
places.description: The modern stadium is the venue for soccer matches, track and field events, and open-air concerts in the city of Zurich.

places.name: Schloss Rapperswil
places.description: Rapperswil Castle is the town's landmark and a unique location for exclusive business events and festive occasions. Its historic rooms provide a stylish setting for large-scale celebrations and meetings for up to 250 guests.

places.name: Tobogganing at Hoch-Ybrig
places.description: From Laucheren summit station, winter sports enthusiasts of all ages can speed down the 2.5 km (1.5 mile) toboggan run into the valley.

places.name: Tobogganing at Sattel-Hochstuckli
places.description: In the picturesque mountain region of Sattel-Hochstuckli, a 3.5 km (2.2 mile) long toboggan run invites snow sports fans to enjoy a thrilling ride on two runners.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Pilatus
places.description: Winter sports fans will be enthralled by this wonderful toboggan run through the woods on the northern spur of the Pilatus.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Chäserrugg
places.description: Tobogganing fans and skilled riders can speed round sporty bends and through romantic forest sections on the Chäserrugg, not far from Zurich.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Rigi
places.description: This well-groomed toboggan run extends for 3.1 kilometers (1.9 miles) and 460 vertical meters (1,500 feet) through the enchanting winter landscape on the Rigi, a popular excursion mountain in Central Switzerland.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Titlis
places.description: Tobogganing fun is guaranteed on the 3.5km (2.2 mile) run on the famous Titlis mountain, high above Engelberg.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Zugerberg
places.description: Tobogganing is even more enjoyable with a view of the beautiful Lake Zug and the mountains of Central Switzerland – on the Zugerberg, close to Zurich.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Stoos
places.description: Awaiting visitors high above the village of Stoos is not only a fast toboggan run, but also one of Switzerland’s finest mountain panoramas.

places.name: Tobogganing at Atzmännig
places.description: In the sports and leisure resort of Atzmännig, there are almost two kilometers (over a mile) of slopes for winter lovers to coast down provided that enough snow has fallen.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Flumserberg
places.description: Not far from Zurich, an absolute winter sports paradise with a 3km (1.9 mile) toboggan run awaits visitors on the Flumserberg. from Zurich, an absolute winter sports paradise with a 3km (1.9 mile) toboggan run awaits visitors on the Flumserberg.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Bachtel
places.description: It is around a one-hour walk to this fast and picturesque toboggan run that awaits visitors on the Bachtel mountain, close to Rapperswil-Jona, when there is enough snow.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Hörnli
places.description: Anyone prepared to take on a roughly 1.5-hour walk is rewarded with a wonderful 4.5 kilometers (2.7 miles) of tobogganing fun.

places.name: Tobogganing on the Uetliberg
places.description: The favorite toboggan run of the local residents is located not far from the city on Zurich’s home mountain, the Uetliberg.

places.name: Sattel-Hochstuckli
places.description: Skiing & Snowboarding: You get to the family-friendly Sattel-Hochstuckli skiing region in just 41 minutes by car from Zurich.

places.name: Sledge Rides in Amden
places.description: In the Amden winter sports area several toboggan runs offer an entertaining alternative to skiing.

places.name: Lago – Zurich’s Nautical Center
places.description: Rent a boat and enjoy Zurich from the water – against a spectacular backdrop extending from the Old Town as far as the Alps.

places.name: Greifensee Skate
places.description: The Greifensee Skate is a classic par excellence.

places.name: Flughafen-Glatttal Skate
places.description: The region around Zurich Airport and in the Zurich lowlands has been superbly developed for skaters.

places.name: Studio Melograno
places.description: Design meets emotion: a space for contemporary design, handpicked objects, and creative inspiration.

places.name: C.B.YOUNES-fashion
places.description: Christine Ben Younes designs made-to-measure women’s fashion in Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: BOOSTER Boutique
places.description: British street style meets vintage classics in the heart of Zurich's Old Town.

places.name: Mammut Store
places.description: Everything to do with hiking, skiing, mountaineering, or climbing is on sale at Mammut.

places.name: collab zürich
places.description: Local and sustainable is of prime importance at collab zürich.

places.name: 2nd Peak
places.description: Here adventurers can find high-quality outdoor clothing and accessories at reasonable prices. And act sustainably, too.

places.name: Nook Kids & Teens
places.description: High quality, extravagant, but also classic garments for cool kids – in the heart of the Old Town.

places.name: On
places.description: Sports enthusiasts worldwide rely on the innovative products from On, a success story that began in Zurich.

places.name: Trunk
places.description: Contemporary and classic clothing for the man of the world: that is what customers can find at Trunk Clothiers in Zürich-Seefeld.

places.name: Visitor Store
places.description: The surf shop in the center of Zurich offers everything a surfer could possibly wish for.

places.name: Label17
places.description: The handbags from Label17 are characterized by their clear-cut, elegant shapes.

places.name: Diepolder Optik
places.description: Diepolder Optik has been making bespoke horn-rimmed glasses for 25 years.

places.name: Stefi Talman
places.description: Whether shoes, purses, or wallets: the label of the designer of the same name, Stefi Talman, stands for high-quality products.

places.name: Viu Eyewear
places.description: The young label, Viu, from Zurich sells eyewear directly to the customer, without intermediary traders. And that with great success.

places.name: EnSoie – Fashion Label with a Family Tradition
places.description: Jewelry, ceramics, clothing, accessories. Those who set great store by style are sure to find something to their liking at enSoie.

places.name: Fata Morgana
places.description: Distinctive jewelry for style-conscious people.

places.name: Qwstion Store
places.description: An inspiring place for sustainable everyday products and contemporary Swiss design.

places.name: Kitchener Plus
places.description: Kitchener is a real treasure trove for individual styles. Besides fashion wear and accessories, it sells writing utensils and fun gift ideas.

places.name: Tasoni
places.description: Fashion lovers can find luxurious yet urban clothing at the Tasoni boutique in Zurich, run by the two sisters, Taya and Tary Sawiris.

places.name: Tiger-Fink
places.description: Particularly beautifully designed baby toys and treasures for the nursery and playroom can be found in Zurich’s Seefeld quarter.

places.name: Mykita
places.description: The place to go for exclusive, handcrafted eyewear is Mykita, located on the outskirts of Zurich’s trendy Langstrasse district.

places.name: Arc’teryx
places.description: Arc’teryx supplies adventurers with stylish products for all outdoor activities.

places.name: DeeCee Style
places.description: At DeeCee Style, denim lovers can find the perfect pair of jeans for every occasion.

places.name: Soeder
places.description: Soeder unites top quality, elegant design, and clear-cut functionality.

places.name: Vestibule
places.description: Vestibule brings a touch of French chic to the City on the Limmat.

places.name: Shopping in Rapperswil
places.description: Rapperswil is a small but attractive shopping paradise for all those who like to browse in leisure.

places.name: Big Flagship Store
places.description: The concept store for all stylists, urbanists, and fashionistas.

places.name: RRRevolve Fair Fashion & Eco Design Store
places.description: The store for fair fashion, sustainable products, and eco design can be found not once, but twice in Zurich.

places.name: Opia
places.description: Opia has grown from a small store on Langstrasse to a renowned boutique on Europaallee.

places.name: Metalli
places.description: The shopping mall in the heart of the picturesque city of Zug.

places.name: Rosenhof Market
places.description: At the Rosenhof Market in the picturesque setting of Zurich’s Old Town, you will not only find objects from distant lands, but also original Swiss handicrafts.

places.name: Och Sport
places.description: The sports store on Bahnhofstrasse stocks a high-quality product range for all types of sports.

places.name: Fizzen
places.description: Fizzen is known for its vintage and secondhand fashionwear – and much more besides.

places.name: Limited Stock
places.description: Limited Stock sells beautiful things that sweeten your life, and rare objects that you simply have to have.

places.name: Freitag Flagship Store Zürich
places.description: If there is one product that carries Zurich out into the big wide world, it is the Freitag bag. But the original should,of course, be bought locally.

places.name: Changemaker
places.description: Here, the focus is on ethics and aesthetics at the same time: Changemaker stands for sustainable, sensible, and beautiful products.
