places.name: Boutique Roma
places.description: Inimitable style, unique selections and distinct brand mix – this is how boutique Roma can be defined.

places.name: Beige Swiss Styling
places.description: With the Zürich label Beige, everything focuses on the material: knitted and unconventional fabrics with their own aesthetics and a high degree of comfort are high on the agenda in terms of design.

places.name: Acood
places.description: Since 1999, professional fashion designer Anka Lehmann and her Acood label have been situated in Zurich.

places.name: Buonvini Wine Store
places.description: Discover exquisite Italian wines and gourmet products in Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Intercomestibles, der Laden
places.description: The Zurich beverage trading company, Inter Comestibles AG, operates a store in the Kreis 4 district, stocking a wide selection of regional and international beverages.

places.name: laflor
places.description: The chocolate from laflor is characterized by its intense flavors, which are created entirely without the use of additives.

places.name: Löw Delights
places.description: Founded and managed by two sisters, a small team of chocolatières produce modern chocolate creations in Zurich’s Kreis 4 district.

places.name: Garçoa Chocolate
places.description: The award-winning bean-to-bar chocolate from Zurich.

places.name: Sprüngli, Zurich Main Station
places.description: Lovers of the exquisite Sprüngli delicacies can find no fewer than four stores at Zurich Main Station.

places.name: Sprüngli, Stadelhoferplatz
places.description: The popular Sprüngli classics, such as Luxemburgerli, truffles, and Bircher muesli, are also on sale at Sechseläutenplatz.

places.name: Sprüngli Bahnhof Oerlikon
places.description: Those with a sweet tooth can find the classic Sprüngli confectionery in the former train station building in Oerlikon.

places.name: The Urban Food Store “Chäs Chäller”
places.description: For all those who want to taste something truly special: At the Urban Food Store, local specialties from small-scale production take food lovers on culinary journeys of discovery.

places.name: VEG and the City
places.description: Amateur gardeners and people with green fingers can find a garden center- with-a-difference close to Zurich Main Train Station.

places.name: Taucherli
places.description: What started as a “Taucherli” – a praline chocolate for dipping in milk – has now developed into a range of exquisite Swiss chocolate bars, drinking chocolate and even chocolate fondue.

places.name: Konditorei Treichler
places.description: It was here that the Zuger Kirschtorte was created over a century ago. Nowadays, this cherry cake is known and loved far beyond the national borders.

places.name: Buchmann Beck Rennweg
places.description: The craft of baking is celebrated here. A small, cute store on the time-honored Rennweg - direct from the cobblestones into the bread paradise.

places.name: Berg und Tal Market Store
places.description: A grocery shop for people who set great store by sustainability, quality and pure indulgence. This gem in Zurich's Kreis 5 has something for everyone.

places.name: Vergani
places.description: Whether in the in-store restaurant in Kreis 3 or on the webshop: this tradition-steeped firm proves its superior status as regards wine and grappa.

places.name: Lindt Chocolate Shop, Kilchberg
places.description: Chocolate wherever you look – this shop not far from Zurich’s city borders makes your mouth water.

places.name: Äss-Bar
places.description: This is no normal bakery, but a store run by people who want to do their bit to cut down on food wastage.

places.name: St. Jakob Beck in the Viadukt
places.description: The St. Jakob Beck bakery is located in the Viadukt indoor markets and provides hungry customers with bread and sweet culinary delights.

places.name: John Baker Helvetiaplatz
places.description: A trendy bakery with delicious wares and a clear-cut philosophy.

places.name: Teehus Rapperswil
places.description: Indian black tea, Chinese green tea, Assam or Oolong: the Teehus in Rapperswil stocks all sorts of different teas, as well as the necessary accessories.

places.name: Milchmanufaktur Einsiedeln
places.description: Alpine cheese, yoghurt, mozzarella: the Milchmanufaktur – or milk manufactory – transforms first-rate Swiss Alpine milk into top-quality products.

places.name: Straumann Hüppen
places.description: Zürcher Hüppen are filled wafer rolls and steeped with tradition – this specialty is said to have been first made in Zurich 400 years ago.

places.name: Tritt Käse
places.description: At Tritt Käse, you can buy delicious cheese variations including curd cheese, as well as milk and yogurt from smaller regional and international producers.

places.name: John Baker Stadelhofen
places.description: The friendly John Baker bakery in the heart of Zurich attaches great importance to regional and seasonal products.

places.name: Auhof, Wagen
places.description: Enjoy the culinary delights of the Lake Zurich region – with tasty, locally grown produce.

places.name: Smith & Smith – Wine Company
places.description: At the wine merchant’s, Smith & Smith, wine connoisseurs and amateurs alike can find a comprehensive selection of first-class wines.

places.name: Max Chocolatier
places.description: Experience chocolate for the first time. This is a feeling that Max Chocolatiers aims to evoke with its delectable chocolate products.

places.name: Lützelhof Farm
places.description: The farm shop selling fresh, home-made farm produce

places.name: Market Oerlikon
places.description: Locals enthuse about the market in Oerlikon – reason enough to pay it a visit.

places.name: Market Hall, Viaduct Arches
places.description: In the market hall under the arches of the railway viaduct in Zürich-West, foodies can find fresh Zurich produce and takeout stands selling delicacies for immediate consumption.

places.name: Market at Helvetiaplatz
places.description: Fresh bread, cheese from the region, or beautiful cut flowers from the nearby nursery – customers can find top-quality products at Helvetiaplatz.

places.name: Läderach Bahnhofstrasse
places.description: Very close to Zurich Main Station, chocolate fans can immerse themselves in the sweet world of Läderach.

places.name: Schuler's Farm Shop – Ludihof Benken
places.description: Fresh produce, dried goods, jams, and syrups are on sale in this family farm store.

places.name: Vollenweider Chocolatier Confiseur
places.description: The Vollenweider family firm is characterized by exquisite craftsmanship and outstanding quality.

places.name: Confiserie Honold
places.description: The Confiserie Honold has been producing exquisite pralines and pastries on Zurich’s Rennweg since 1905.

places.name: Teuscher
places.description: The opulently decorated stores of the true  Zurich confectionery are known all over the world.

places.name: Schwarzenbach Kolonialwaren
places.description: Schwarzenbach has been the specialist store for coffee, tea, and chocolate since 1864.

places.name: Sprüngli Boutique at Paradeplatz
places.description: All the classic Sprüngli products can be purchased at the main branch of the famous Zurich confectionery.

places.name: Say Chocolate Boutique
places.description: Personalized chocolate pralines are the specialty of this small boutique on Europaallee.

places.name: Restaurant Drei Stuben
places.description: Traditional and original furnishings, modern and contemporary food: the Drei Stuben in the heart of the city is a treat for both the eye and the palate.

places.name: Restaurant Arvenbüel
places.description: Seasonal specialties, a large terrace with a magnificent view, and heartfelt hospitality draw guests to the Arvenbüel, situated in Amden.

places.name: Sir Andrew’s Restaurant
places.description: The Sir Andrew’s restaurant, which is dedicated to the world of pirates, is a place of pure enjoyment.

places.name: Restaurant & Bar Tschadun
places.description: Near Zurich Airport, hungry guests will find the Tschadun restaurant with bar.

places.name: Bauernschänke
places.description: A modern interpretation of simple, global culinary classics awaits guests at the Bauernschänke restaurant at Rindermarkt.

places.name: The Butcher in Zürich-West
places.description: Amidst this rustic ambiance, the succulent burgers taste just as fresh and aromatic as avid burger fans could possibly wish.

places.name: Erlenbach–Küsnacht Gorge Path – Babbling Brooks and Hidden Natural Gems
places.description: This walk follows two idyllic gorges and features waterfalls, caves, and geological wonders.

places.name: Loorenkopf Trail – from the Fällanden Ravine to Zurich Zoo
places.description: This spectacular hike takes walkers through a stunning natural landscape from Fällanden to the top of the Zürichberg.

places.name: Forest and Waid Circuit Hike Around Käferberg
places.description: A short hike through Käferberg’s green nature – with forest paths, playgrounds and beautiful views.

places.name: Trendy Wiedikon
places.description: Wiedikon represents diversity, trendiness and urban coolness. This walk leads through one of the most vibrant neighborhoods.

places.name: Zurich’s Design and Industrial Quarter
places.description: The city walk that combines water, design, industrial history and city life – from the Limmat river to creative Viadukt to bustling district 5.

places.name: Waterside City Walk
places.description: This walk winds through the center of Zurich, following three iconic waterways – from the tranquil Schanzengraben canal to the wide promenade at Lake Zurich and the vibrant banks of the Limmat river.

places.name: Hops Beer Trail
places.description: Enjoy discovering the Swiss “hop mountains”.

places.name: Alpine Panorama Trail Unterägeri – Zug
places.description: Experience Switzerland as if it were straight out of a promotional video: this is possible on the route between Unterägeri and Zug.

places.name: Way of St. James
places.description: On this 17 km (11 mile) route between Rapperswil and Einsiedeln, hikers pass through beautiful landscapes and an important piece of world history.

places.name: Lägern Ridge Hike
places.description: This wonderful hike leads from Regensberg near Zurich to Baden.

places.name: Ägeri Valley Panorama Trail
places.description: This panorama path covers a distance of almost 18 kilometers (11 miles) and leads from Unterägeri via a hilly stretch to the village of Morgarten.

places.name: High Mountain Trail Schwyz (Sattel–Haggenegg Section)
places.description: This section of the Schwyz panorama trail leads right through the Sattel-Hochstuckli region.

places.name: Rigi Panoramic Trail
places.description: This popular panorama path is simply stunning, affording magnificent views of Lake Lucerne and Lake Zug, as well as of the imposing Alps in the distance.

places.name: Crest Hike Stoos
places.description: This ridge hike treats walkers to a fascinating view of more than 10 Swiss lakes and countless Alpine peaks.

places.name: Flumserberg – 7 Peaks Views Tour
places.description: This splendid panoramic tour, which takes in seven mountain peaks and 14 lake views, is suitable for proficient, fit hikers who would like to explore the Alpine region very close to Zurich.

places.name: «7-Egg» Trail Ybrig
places.description: A high-Alpine trail with imposing far-reaching views of the high Alps, lakes and valleys.

places.name: Amden Marmot Trail – Family Fun on Mattstock
places.description: On the marmot trail above Amden, families can discover nature’s secrets with the help of Amdo the marmot.

places.name: Lama Trekking
places.description: Lama trekking in Zurich’s wine-growing region is a memorable experience for people of all ages.

places.name: Mülitobel-Sihl-Weg
places.description: This hike could easily be called the «Water walk». It starts at Lake Zürich, passes through two of the year round water-bearing gorges and takes hikers past three ponds and a bathing lake.

places.name: Hiking from Forch to Meilen – Trail Pfannenstiel
places.description: The fantastic hike across the Pfannenstiel ridge offers the best views of Lake Zurich.

places.name: Zurich Wilderness Park Sihlwald
places.description: Zurich Wilderness Park Sihlwald is a protected forest reserve and offers plenty of room for nature experiences and recreation.

places.name: Langenberg Wildlife Park
places.description: Wolfs etc. – Explore the wild animals of Switzerland at the Langenberg wildlife park, west of Lake Zurich.

places.name: Golf Park Zürichsee – Golf by Lake Zurich
places.description: The idyllic location makes golf on Upper Lake Zurich a real experience at the Golf Park Zürichsee.

places.name: Ybrig Golf Club – Golf With Panoramic Mountain Views
places.description: This 18-hole golf course offers genuine golfing pleasure, surrounded by a spectacular mountain landscape.

places.name: Boat Rentals from Bootsvermietung Enge
places.description: From vintage pedalos and rowing boats to (electric) motorboats, Lake Zurich is best enjoyed from the water.

places.name: Wipkingerpark
places.description: Nature, recreation, and fun on the bank of the Limmat river.

places.name: Kasernenareal
places.description: Multifaceted space for culture and relaxation.

places.name: Fritschiwiese
places.description: A vibrant neighborhood park in Zurich.

places.name: Idaplatz
places.description: A green jewel in the heart of Zurich.

places.name: Stauffacher
places.description: A busy interchange with urban appeal.

places.name: Wifio – Pocket Wifi
places.description: Securely connected, anywhere in Switzerland –easily and flexibly.

places.name: Hallenbad City
places.description:
Built in the Landistil architectural style, the public indoor swimming pool in the city center impresses with its high glass façades and its 50-meter (164ft) pool, which was 
the first in Switzerland.

places.name: Tudor Boutique Bucherer
places.description: The watch brand from Western Switzerland offers a wide range of fine luxury watches.

places.name: Werd Island
places.description: A classic walk that everyone in Zurich knows is the idyllic riverside path from the main station to Werd Island.

places.name: Koenig Jewellery
places.description: Here, exquisite pieces of jewelry are created according to the highest standards of the jeweler’s art. The family business with its own manufactory in the Graubünden mountains is currently in the hands of the third generation.

places.name: AGUAdeORO
places.description: Whether engagement or wedding rings, or diamond jewelry for the ears or the neck, AGUAdeORO offers luxury jewelry that is of the highest quality and ethically sourced.

places.name: Zurich Urban Kayak
places.description: Kayaking in the heart of Zurich: Thanks to Neklan, a real Kayak enthusiast, visitors get to experience Zurich from the water in the summer.

places.name: Mootes
places.description: At Mootes, discerning men will find an extensive selection of high-quality grooming and natural care products.

places.name: Tourist Information
places.description: Visitors can get insider tips and information about city tours, excursions, and much more at the Tourist Information at Zurich Main Station.

places.name: White Pearl Yachting
places.description: Private cruises on Lake Zurich – for individuals or corporate events on board classic motor yachts and boats.

places.name: Wick Wohnkultur
places.description: Beautiful things for the home can be found at Wick Wohnkultur, in the heart of Zurich’s Old Town.

places.name: Zugerberg Bike Trail
places.description: Awaiting proficient mountain bikers on the Zugerberg is a flow trail, with challenging alternative routes for more advanced riders.

places.name: Obersee Adventure Trail
places.description: Around the Obersee lake, treasure hunters of all ages can solve puzzles, search, and discover.

places.name: Victorinox Brand Store
places.description: The store featuring the most famous pocketknife in the world.

places.name: The Circle
places.description: Numerous stores, restaurants, several hotels, and a park have transformed the area around the airport into a new quarter in Zurich.

places.name: Zürich Tourism Gift Vouchers
places.description: Surprise your friends or relatives with a Zürich Tourism gift voucher.

places.name: Heinicke Watches
places.description: Renowned Swiss watch brands on Limmatquai since 1937

places.name: Boda Borg Rümlang
places.description: Reality gaming for teenagers and adults can be found in the huge Boda Borg Hall in Rümlang, near Zurich.

places.name: Seebad Lattenberg
places.description: This lido in Stäfa, featuring a sandy beach and an attractive grassy area, invites visitors to relax.

places.name: Rechberg (Park)
places.description: Situated between the Kunsthaus and Zurich University is the well preserved Rechberg park, home to the most beautiful baroque garden in Zurich.

places.name: Flip Lab Riedmatt
places.description: A hall full of trampolines guarantees plenty of fun over a 3,000 sq.m. area on 365 days a year – and not only children love jumping through the air.

places.name: Freibad Heuried
places.description: Swimming, splashing, sunbathing, and having fun: the Freibad Heuried is one of the most popular open-air public baths in Zurich.

places.name: Lake Ägeri
places.description: Over 700 years ago, the lakeshore was the scene of the famous Battle of Morgarten. Today things are rather more peaceful, and you can swim, sail, and fish here undisturbed.

places.name: Hoch-Ybrig Bike Tour
places.description: This circular bike tour between Einsiedeln and Hoch-Ybrig requires grit and stamina – but the wonderful panorama makes all the effort worthwhile.

places.name: Seebadi Rapperswil
places.description: The “Schlossbadi”, as this lido is also known due to its location at the foot of Rapperswil Castle, is a tranquil and picturesque oasis.

places.name: Urbansurf Zurich
places.description: Surfing in the middle of the city? Thanks to this unique outdoor surfing facility in Zürich-West, novice and professional surfers alike can dream a little of Hawaii.

places.name: Meister 1881 Silver & Table Culture
places.description: Situated in the heart of the Old Town is the largest silver store in Switzerland, which can look back on a long tradition.

places.name: Zigarren Dürr – Davidoff Flagship Store
places.description: Zurich’s top address for friends of this stylish smoking pleasure.

places.name: Rampe5 – ZeroWaste Ladencafé
places.description: Only buy what you really need and thus avoid waste? That is possible at the Rampe5 store-café.

places.name: Parfumerie Osswald
places.description: A magical place in the heart of the city, where the most exquisite fragrances in the world are married together to form new creations.

places.name: Max Affolter Swiss Watches & Jewellery
places.description: This boutique in the heart of the Old Town has a large selection of brand-name watches and exquisite jewelry for lovers of fine goods.

places.name: Patek Philippe Boutique
places.description: The first dealer-run Patek Philippe Boutique in Switzerland is located directly next to Beyer Chronometrie on Bahnhofstrasse, in the very heart of Zurich.

places.name: Paradisimo
places.description: Der Indoorspielplatz mit Café und spassigen Spielgeräten.

places.name: Supkultur – Stand Up Paddle School Zurich
places.description: Besides various SUP courses, the stand-up paddling school, Supkultur, also rents out boards so that guests can immediately head out onto the lake.

places.name: Weekly Markets in Zug
places.description: Various weekly markets are held throughout the year on the Landsgemeindeplatz, in the heart of Zug’s Old Town.

places.name: Weekly Markets in Winterthur
places.description: Two weekly markets, held in the heart of Winterthur’s Old Town, delight lovers of fresh, seasonal produce.

places.name: Weekly Market at Bürkliplatz
places.description: One of the most popular markets among Zurich’s residents is without doubt the weekly market at Bürkliplatz – or the “Bürklimäärt” as the locals call it.

places.name: Weekly Market in Altstetten
places.description: Every Saturday, the friendly, traditional weekly market is held on the Lindenplatz, in the western part of the city.

places.name: Souvenirs at the Tourist Information
places.description: Chocolate, postcards, wooden figures, the legendary Swiss Army Knife and all kinds of other souvenirs can be purchased at the Tourist Information, centrally located in Zurich’s Main Station.

places.name: Flagship Store Victorinox
places.description: A real piece of Swiss tradition – super sharp and if desired also in a modern design. The Swiss Army Knife and much more are on sale in the store.

places.name: Swiss National Museum Shop
places.description: Swiss products as a souvenir, gift, or to learn or experience – a museum boutique with an extensive range of products.

places.name: Jaeger-LeCoultre Boutique
places.description: Lovers of watches from the Swiss watch manufacture Jaeger-LeCoultre can buy these exclusive timepieces on the Bahnhofstrasse in Zurich.

places.name: Bucherer Boutique Rolex
places.description: Exclusive boutiques and stores line Zurich’s prestigious Bahnhofstrasse. It goes without saying that one of them is a Rolex specialist retailer.

places.name: Bruderhaus Wildlife Park
places.description: At the Bruderhaus Wildlife Park near Winterthur, adventurers follow the trail of wild animals such as wolves and lynxes.

places.name: Skills Park Winterthur
places.description: Winterthur is home to the currently largest multisport hall in Europe.

places.name: Formel Fun – Play Center for Children
places.description: The children’s play center with many changing attractions guarantees plenty of fun and is a great option for children’s birthday parties.

places.name: Adlisberg Mountain Bike Trail in Zurich
places.description: The Bike Trail on the Adlisberg has plenty to offer: what starts with a gentle descent ends with a challenging track.

places.name: Mountain Bike Trails on the Uetliberg in Zurich
places.description: The Uetliberg is the local “mountain” of the city of Zurich. Thus mountain bikers do not have to travel far to have fun on some official bike trails.

places.name: Circular Bike Tour Farner
places.description: From the Uznach stork colony to Oberricken and Farner: the Farner route offers unspoilt nature and a lot of altitude on the edge of the agglomeration of Zürich.

places.name: Circular Bike Tour “Egg”
places.description: This medium-difficulty tour leads from the Linth plain into the foothills of the Speer, a pyramid of conglomerate rock.

places.name: Bike Tour from Zurich to Einsiedeln
places.description: The tour from Zurich to Einsiedeln shows just how remarkably close lovely landscapes are to the city.

places.name: Blumen Krämer
places.description: The flower store, Blumen Krämer, was established in 1897 and has been bringing a touch of color to the homes of Zurich’s residents ever since.

places.name: Marktlücke
places.description: Those who shop at Marktlücke not only purchase unique handcrafted objects, but also support social workshops and small enterprises in Switzerland.

places.name: Dolder Outdoor Pool
places.description: In summer, the Dolder Bad open-air swimming facility, which lies in the middle of a forest, is a popular haunt among locals and visitors alike.

places.name: Brunni-Alpthal Ski Lift
places.description: One of the most attractive ski areas in Switzerland lies not far from Einsiedeln and offers superb views of the two Mythen mountains.

places.name: Swiss Ski and Snowboard School Hoch-Ybrig
places.description: The Hoch-Ybrig winter sports paradise is just an hour’s drive from Zurich.

places.name: Hensa Pedal Boat Hire in Rapperswil
places.description: A perfect way to relax: with a pedal boat, you can explore Lake Zurich using your own muscle power.

places.name: Velonauta
places.description: In Zurich, biking fans buy their personal, customized bicycles at Velonauta, in the Viadukt shopping mall in Zurich-West.

places.name: Fabrikat
places.description: At Fabrikat, handicraft enthusiasts, artist and craftspeople will find the perfect utensils to express their creativity.

places.name: Josefwiese
places.description: Whether football players, BBQ enthusiasts, sun worshippers or families with children – when the weather is fine, everyone convenes in the Josefwiese park in Zurich-West.

places.name: Seleger Moor Park
places.description: An enchanting place for wonderful hours surrounded by the beauty of nature.

places.name: IWC Schaffhausen Boutique
places.description: The boutique of this Swiss luxury watch manufacture is located on Zurich's famous Bahnhofstrasse.

places.name: Bächlihof Jona – the Adventure Farm by Lake Zurich
places.description: There is plenty to explore and experience outside the city, too: the Bächlihof in Rapperswil-Jona is the perfect place for a great day out with all the family.

places.name: Tissot Boutique Zurich
places.description: The Swiss brand, Tissot, presents its highly diverse range of high-end watches in an elegant boutique on Zurich's Bahnhofstrasse.

places.name: Wollerau Weekly Market
places.description: Fresh products from the village and surrounding area can be purchased at the Wollerau weekly market.

places.name: Uster Weekly Market
places.description: Every Friday morning, Uster residents come to the weekly market to purchase fresh products from the region.

places.name: Stäfa Weekly Market
places.description: The weekly fresh market in Stäfa is  promoted under the witty name of "SMäRT".

places.name: Robenhausen Weekly Market, Wetzikon
places.description: The "Robehuuser Wuchemärt" is the market in the Robenhausen quarter of Wetzikon

places.name: Rapperswil Friday Market
places.description: If you visit Rapperswil on a Friday, you should be sure to visit the fresh produce market.

places.name: Meilen Weekly Market
places.description: Weekly fresh produce market in the pretty village of Meilen, on Lake Zurich.

places.name: Lachen Market
places.description: Hungry visitors can also find fresh produce from the region in Lachen, on Lake Zurich.

places.name: "Fällander Märt" – Fällanden Market
places.description: Der Fällander Wochenmärt ist ein beliebter Begegnungsort und Treffpunkt.

places.name: H100
places.description: The place to go for fans of designer and classic furniture.

places.name: Knie’s Children’s Zoo
places.description: Knie’s Children’s Zoo belongs to Switzerland’s tradition-steeped Knie Circus, and is a popular meeting place for animal lovers of all ages.

places.name: Snowshoe Walking in Amden
places.description: A snowshoe hike through the peaceful winter landscape is pure relaxation for all nature lovers.

places.name: Kanzlei Flea Market
places.description: After a night out on the town, you can head directly to the flea market: this popular second-hand market is held every Saturday.

places.name: Flea Market Bürkliplatz
places.description: This flea market is much more than its name suggests: It is a paradise for treasure hunters in search of unique pieces and rarities.

places.name: Flower and Vegetable Market Gemüsebrücke
places.description: Since time immemorial, the bridge near the Town Hall has been known as the Vegetable Bridge – because there has always been a market there.

places.name: Skiing and Snowboarding in Amden
places.description: The resorts Mattstock and Arvenbuel in the region Amden, overlooking the Walensee lake, are only around 70 km (43.5 miles) from Zurich.

places.name: Zurich Aviary and Bird Sanctuary
places.description: On the banks of Lake Zurich, you can find the Zurich aviary and bird sanctuary on the Mythenquai. Here you can admire a wide range of birds.

places.name: Gliding with Schänis – Explore the Alps From the Air
places.description: The Schänis airfield offers views of the Swiss Alps from a bird's eye perspective.

places.name: Uznach Stork Colony
places.description: The Uznach stork colony contains around 30 storks, which can be observed live and up close

places.name: Rieterpark – Zurich's Largest Park
places.description: The glamor of the 19th century is still evident in the Rieterpark today. This is the largest park in Zurich with over 70,000m2 of space.

places.name: A hot air balloon trip over Lake Zurich
places.description: With a hot air balloon trip, you will feel free as a bird and can explore the region in an unusual way.

places.name: Zurich Zoo & Masoala Rainforest
places.description: Home to more than 365 animal species, Zurich Zoo is a must for all animal lovers. It shows the incredible diversity of wildlife within a small area.

places.name: Platzspitz Park
places.description: Platzspitz Park is one of the oldest and most historical areas of greenery in Zurich.

places.name: Juckerhof Seegräben – Farm Adventure by the Pfäffikersee Lake
places.description: Not only fruit and vegetables grow on the Juckerhof  – it's a place of adventure for families to enjoy.

places.name: Höllgrotten Baar
places.description: Immerse in a fairy-tale-like underground world – the Höllgrotten caves enchant old and young alike.

places.name: Kaltbrunner Riet
places.description: The Kaltbrunner Riet is situated on the Linth plateau and is a marshland area of international significance.

places.name: Botanical Garden Grüningen
places.description: The natural oasis of the Botanical Garden is located close to the historic town of Grüningen.

places.name: Botanical Garden of the University of Zürich
places.description: The Botanical Garden shows off its best side in spring but the tropical greenhouses are also worth a visit in bad weather.

places.name: Belvoir Park
places.description: Belvoir Park is a historic park with large meadows, pools, old trees, a pergola and benches.

places.name: Old Botanical Garden
places.description: The Old Botanical Garden is an idyllic oasis at the heart of downtown Zurich. Its history dates back to the year 1837.

places.name: Stäfa Pedal Boat Rentals – Pedal Boating on Lake Zurich
places.description: Enjoy the summer on Lake Zurich with a pedal boat – you can rent one in Stäfa.

places.name: Männerbad Schanzengraben
places.description: The men’s open-air bathing facility at the historic Schanzengraben is an oasis of peace, despite its location in the heart of the city.

places.name: Alpamare
places.description: Twelve thrilling water slides guarantee to keep the adrenaline pumping at the largest water park in Switzerland.

places.name: Gübelin
places.description: The Swiss company for exquisite jewelry and exclusive watches.

places.name: Christ Watches & Jewelry
places.description: The Swiss chain of jewelry stores welcomes lovers of selected watches and jewelry at its branch on Bahnhofstrasse and in other locations.

places.name: Teddy’s Souvenir-Shop
places.description: The legendary souvenir store on Limmatquai stocks a huge selection of gifts.

places.name: Schweizer Heimatwerk
places.description: Genuine Swiss handicraft from local production: these souvenirs are guaranteed “Made in Switzerland”.

places.name: Maurice de Mauriac – Watches Made by Zurich
places.description: At Maurice de Mauriac, watch connoisseurs can find top-quality, customized timepieces.

places.name: Schanzengraben
places.description: In the heart of the city yet far away from the  hustle and bustle, the idyllic promenade connects the Main Station with Lake Zurich.

places.name: Bulgari
places.description: The famous jewelry and watch brand is also available at two locations in Zurich.

places.name: Bucherer
places.description: Over 100 years since it was first established, this family business is now the Swiss branch leader in the sale of watches and jewellery.

places.name: Beyer Watches & Jewellery
places.description: The oldest watch retailer in Switzerland is situated on Bahnhofstrasse, in the very heart of Zurich.

places.name: Meister 1881
places.description: The Zurich jewelry and watches store can look back on a long tradition.

places.name: Sibler
places.description: Anyone looking for high-quality household articles in Zurich should pay a visit to Sibler at Münsterhof.

places.name: Landolt-Arbenz
places.description: As far back as 1882, customers have loved this store for its elegant and high-quality writing culture.

places.name: Kurz Jewellery and Watches
places.description: The Kurz jewelry store is located directly on Bahnhofstrasse. Besides exclusive pieces of jewelry, it stocks a number of premium watch brands.

places.name: Messer-scharf
places.description: The specialty store for knives enjoys a prime location, just around the corner from the Grossmünster church.

places.name: Meng Cutlery
places.description: As a special souvenir or a present – Meng Cutlery offers a wide range of authentic Swiss souvernirs in two central locations in Zurich.
